12.description: Hello, My name is Tammy and I am a Pizzaholic.My friend calls me a Pizza Snob and I wear the crown gracefully.So, last night was my 3rd tasting of Margarita's. I would have given them 4 stars but you'll understand why.In my opinion, Margarita Pizza Makers/Chefs give me the feeling that they once worked at Italian Fiesta. If I were blind-folded and had to choose which one was from  I.F., I couldn't guess. The XL Pizza's are TRULY EXTRA LARGE. They're ingredients were fresh. I ordered a sausage/pepperoni for the kids and a sausage/mushroom/black olive for myself. EXCELLENT!!! I also ordered a 4 wing dinner that included fries and mostacholi and garlic bread.  If you're a fan of BIG/Full Figured Chicken wings this is the place for you. I prefer smaller wings however they could be seasoned a little better. The mostacholi was decent with plenty of meat in the sauce. Delivery was within an hour yet the Pizza wasn't piping hot. (I like to see steam). The only drawback is the pricing. While I am willing to pay for quality food, I spent $61.73 for 2 XL Pizzas, a 4 wing dinner, and delivery.

3.description: if you love Italian Fiesta, you will definitely love here! great Mexican food also. Well priced.

1.description: My family historically (like for generations) ate Italian Fiesta until I found Margarita's in 2000. If you love Italian Fiesta, you will definitely love them! Great thin crust, fresh ingredients. Beggars and the rest pale in comparison!  They also have excellent Mexican food and fried chicken. Well priced. They've had the same in-store manager for almost 20 years. Hey Luther!Try them, u won't be disappointed.

2.description: Very good pizza! Nice,  thin, greasy, flavorful pizza!

9.description: This was my first time ordering...pizza came on time...piping hot...fresh...delicious!!!

10.description: Pizza is delicious thin crust its in the hood so it's carryout only I believe they have delivery we got a super sized cheese and sausage cook perfect people very nice and it came with a liter of soda working in the neighborhood and if I'm back in the hood I will order again

4.description: Got to say some of the Best pizza in Chicago in the 2010's. Hands down. I tried them all. Consistently I'd stick with California Pizza kitchen, Connie's and Home run Inn but I wanted to make this list.It would go in this order- 1980's-Italian Fiesta-71st & Jeffery1990's-Ginos east pizza-Superior& Michigan2000-Giordano's Pizza- Rush Street & Wabash2010's-Margarita's Pizza-79th Street

6.description: We ordered a med pizza and an Italian combo. The order taker and female delivery person was very nice. However, there's a Hispanic guy I spoke w/who was the ruddest person I talked with!! The combo was horrible and his attitude was just as horrible!!! When I explained who hirrid the meat was, he said it's all the same. So we ordered the jumbo shrimp at 9:28pm. It's is 10:45pm and still waiting!. I called the guy(same one), he said they will be here in a few minutes. Still waiting at 10:47pm. Im totally disgusted w/this place as well as the manager. Horrible attitude. We pd 27.00 w/a 5.00 tip. Very disappointed. Never again.

0.description: One of the best pizza spots in Chicago! In the hood but pizza so good!Great family size pizza. Better than the location on 75th lol

5.description: Ordered a cat fish well done gOt A greasy half done mess

13.description: The pizza is AWESOME, but I just can't get past the rude person answering the phone. But it's so good. What to do???? Lol

11.description: I ordered individual pizza with sausage and onions and it was great. It is enough to feed two. I also tried their chicken wings and this is where they get the fifth star...chicken was very crispy and flavorful..not greasy at all...these were fried wings..I would definitely recommend..and they deliver to the pill hill area. Please try them if you can.

8.description: Pizza ok ! Dry cardboard really with chesse this place was ridiculous I don't know who thought this was what you call pizza but is nothing compared dry sandpaper

14.description: Best thin crust pizza in Chicago. Nice crispy edges, tasty toppings. Fast delivery (usually about 45 minutes). Good Italian sandwiches, fries and cole slaw, too. Take out and delivery only, no tables for eating in. Prices very reasonable.

7.description: The prices are affordable. The pizza is the next best thing to Italian Fiesta. I usually get a veggie pizza or pepperoni with fries, it's worth trying.

3.description: This is the only Baskin Robbins around here that has the Gold Medal Ribbon ice cream flavor. Plus their waffle cones taste fresh and the ice cream consistency is always perfect.

1.description: Two stars for my breakfast sandwich that was amazing!!! If you haven't tried the sausage egg and cheese croissant, the. You don't know what your missing. It blows McDonald's and Burger King away. However that coffee is disgusting or maybe I'm just a coffee snob who enjoys paying way too much at Starbucks!! But at least their coffee is delicious. I had the iced mocha swirl with cream and sugar today and I just wanted to throw the whole cup out the window while driving but didn't for fear of it splashing into the open mouth of a driver and that driver would end up passing out from the horrible taste.. I don't even know how to describe the taste of this grotesque and disgusting drink.. But all I can say is I won't be buying coffee from them in a long time..

2.description: Slower service but still Dunkin' Donuts!  The staff is friendly and the product is good, but it takes a long time to get through basic orders.  Perhaps they were short staffed due to drive-thru.Lucky I needed coffee.

0.description: This 24- hour sweet shop is definitely an asset to the community. Fast service, friendly staff, and fresh goods. Don't be put off by the dark,  Old-school, street lighting  (blame it on the city). This location is as secure as any downtown shop, in the middle of the day, or any time of night. Chicago's Finest , as well as CTA drivers are extremely frequent customers.

4.description: Can you pretty please have more variety of donuts? Every time I walk in there's only plain . Where is the lemon filling donuts? More jelly please, coconut, apple pie?  can you offer gluten free??

3.description: This has got to be the best pizza on the east side. The crust is perfect, the sauce is delicious and the cheese is melted and melts in your mouth. I love this place. I have been searching for a good pizza place near and found a great one. They have specials that are awesome and the sizes are true to size. you wont be disappointed at all.

1.description: Very rude unprofessional service, I called once to place an order and the man over the phone told me to put my parents of the phone, shocked I told him i was over 18 and have called before multiple times without any issue and he proceeded to tell me to "go f*** myself* IF I COULD GIVE THEM NEGATIVE STARS I WOULD. Their food is not worth being disrespected and insulted, go to capri or de arco's instead!

2.description: WORST PLACE TO ORDER FOOD FROM. The manager is an asshole who will not take orders if you forget to pick up an order ONCE. They are highly unprofessional. The staff act like they are still in high school. I have found a roach in my bag on more than one occasion and they tried to blame it on me . EAT HERE AT YOUR OWN RISK.

5.description: I tried the pizza yesterday and I must say "Yay! I'm a fan". The prices at Maya's Pizza definitely does not hurt your pockets...in fact it does the exact opposite. They have many specials like 2 jumbo pizzas for under $24 and a small 1-topping pizza for under $8. One of the other amazing factors is that the location is only a 5 minute drive from my apartment. I will definitely be back whenever I am feeling the need to cheat with my diet again!

6.description: 5 stars for their Italian beefs with cheese or no cheese...

7.description: The huge slices of DELICIOUS pizza are worth the trip here!I'm not even a pizza person, but this is somewhere I make a special trip.

8.description: Good food when u want something fast n quick..pizza is good...

9.description: They have pretty good pie here.  We usually order the sausage or ground beef.  If you get one of their menus, they have several specials on pizza from which to choose.Hidden gem here are the potato wedges.  They are huge and quite tasty.  They aren't listed on their menu but come with an order of broasted chicken if you ask.  The chicken's ok but I've had better.I'm not too crazy about their sandwiches except the meatball which is fine.  They also have rib tips, fish, shrimp, and other items too numerous to mention.If you get delivery the guy will usually call you when he approaches your place.

0.description: Headed to the southside for some much deserved pizza (he'll I loves me some pizza) found this hole in the wall (no disrespect) the cheesy bread was delicious,  I order a very simple sausage and cheese pie and loved every bit of it...... the reason for 4 and not 5 stars is because there was no place to really sit and this is definitely a take out spot so while gulping down a pizza in my car was amazing it wasn't as comfortable, still great pizza

4.description: I was skeptical to try the pizza here but I thought it was a Mexican restaurant because of the neighborhood it's in. Someone suggested it to me, so I gave in to my skepticism and the pizza here is off the chain! Not only is it cheap but it tastes good. They have a lot of specials, and their grilled chicken salad is good too. Did I mention they deliver? They're fairly close to my apartment but with the upcoming Winter, I think I'll be utilizing their driver a lot more. Good jumbo pizzas at pocket friendly prices. You really can't beat that.

0.description: I've gone to this ice cream store every summer (and even once recently) to get my delicious HOME-MADE fixes! Try the yummy home-made liquid nut yogurt with your choice of natural fruits, cut on spot, and granola, raisins, and coconut on top! I also like strawberry yogurt with banana, strawberry, guava, and papaya, but you can add a lot more, such as pineapple, apple, red grapes, and more! The service is very friendly and organized. The place is clean and always has customers.Try the home-made ice cream, especially the non-alcoholic tequila and gansito! Most flavors are very good. Get some home-made popsicles to go for a hot summer day--unique flavors, too! Other Mexican snack foods are also sold, such as taco salad chips in-a-bag or different foods with "cueritos" (if you like "pork skins"--I'm not a fan). (I must say that if you're not from the neighborhood, don't go here when it's dark outside to be safe.)

3.description: While I'm not a fan of their mexican food, but that's just me being picky about mexican food outside of actually cooking it mysefl. Gomez is a south chicago staple. Don't get me wrong their mexican food is well enough (my mom always orders their tacos), but I always much rather prefer their americanized staples. Their bacon double cheeseburger is always huge and so good. Their pizzas slices are awesome. And I love ordering the fries with the orange hot sauce! Any south sider has to know that.

1.description: Orded 70 worth of food last night.3 orders were don't incorrectly.tryed to resolve this but got no where.take yoursub par food and put it where the sun doesn't shine,I'm sure you know where that is.lost dozens of my friends and family for ever.learn how to write orders correctly.

2.description: Whoever took our order on the phone did not sound like she should be taking the order over the phone not to pleasant. Still waiting for food now so crossing my fingers that it all comes right.

5.description: This south side greasy spoon has some items on their menu worth mentioning, their tacos and burritos.  The burritos are of a monstrous size and the tacos have an authentic taste to them.  other than that its your average fast food restaurant that sells multiple fast American cuisine; cheeseburgers, pizza slices, onion rings etcetera.

6.description: This is my "go-to" place for cheese fries in the 'hood. A small serving is under $2 and ready in less than 5 minutes. Their menu has Mexican food as well as burgers, pizza, etc. Most people get their food to-go but there is a decent seating area.Staff is friendly and busts their arses. I was watching the woman working the pizza station through the windows and she was gettin' it done. I also dig Gomez because they donate (good) food to our special events. Way to support the community!

7.description: great food and great service,  My favorite food to order from them is the  Qasadillia  chicken dinner. My mom's favorite meal is the steak burrito with extra cheese, avocado, and sour cream. Let me tell you how great their customer service is. One night, my mom ordered a burrito from Gomez and instead of putting steak in her burrito it was chicken. My mom was upset and called about it and they came all the way to her house and replaced the burrito and took the wrong burrito back. They came back because they wanted her to enjoy her meal. They didn't harass her or anything. That is real customer service and some need to learn from them. Love you Gomez Taco's

0.description: Food is good. Owner is great, he always make sure you're satisfied and ordering exactly what you want. My only issue are the order takers in person and over the phone. Its like they have an attitude and sometimes the order is slightly incorrect when you arrive. Overall, they're always open when I need something to nibble on.

4.description: Yesterday I got on the Metra and the entire metra car smelled like a Pepe's or mexican restaurant.  Of course this made me now want some mexican food. Normally I would stop by Cocula but lately they have been really rude so i've made up my mind not to patronize them until they get it together! Recently I received a flyer stuck on my door for Gomez Tacos's and this was the perfect time to give them a try. They are supppppper slow. It was like 3 ppl in total in the restaurant and it took about 20 minutes to get my 3 tacos. I made up in my mind this was the one and only chance they got from me. But!! When i got home and opened my food i was plesantly surprised. The tacos were nice and fat and piled high was goodness. The food was good, not great, but good.

28.description: I'd heard a lot of great things about Capri's pizza, so I was originally worried that it wouldn't live up to the hype... But the first bite with hot, crisping cheese over some awesome toppings on an insanely good thin (but not too thin!) crust made me a believer! This pizza can seriously compete with the best in the country! It's not a dine-in place, but I think the reviewer who gave one star on the basis of the neighborhood (welcome to South Chicago, random Texas lady...), but didn't even try the pizza made a HUGE mistake - she'll never know how close she came to a slice of food perfection!The broasted chicken (think fried but more juicy and delicious) has the best crispy skin you'll ever try, and their diverse menu has quite a few other gems, but I can't seem to bring myself to stop eating the pizza long enough to explore!

1.description: Oh noooooo. What happened to this place? I grew up in the neighborhood and have had this pizza as a kid for 30 years plus. Now living in California, I was excited to order one on a return trip. Bad news, pizza doesn't taste the same. Crust texture was like cardboard. Tasteless sauce. Worst service ever. Ordered an xl half sausage half green pepper/onion. Arrived to pick up and pizza was not ready. "5min sir". An hour passed since the phone order was placed. 15min later and 5 employees hover around the order slip discussing what  should go on the pizza. "5min sir". Finally I walked up to ask again if they forgot to make the order. "Oh no, it's almost ready". Finally, pizza is ready. 1 hour plus. I ask for some Parmesan cheese. "Oh that's extra". Then he decides to not charge. Geez thanks. Get home and open pizza. Pepperoni!!!!!   A little green pepper and onion spread here and there. FAIL. Never ordering here again.

9.description: Okay I'm in the neighborhood working.  Me and a co worker order a pizza.   Thing crust with sausage, green pepper, mushroom, onion, extra sauce and well done.  Simple enough.  Pizza is GREASY, we used 15 napkins to soak em up.  Gross.  After we start eating we noticed that they used canned mushrooms instead of fresh, gross.  This was just your typical cheap pizza.  21 bucks for a medium pizza.  Dont come here

29.description: WARNING!So on my way through Chicago, I wanted some good pizza.  I used Yelp to find this place, chose it on the basis of the reviews I read on here, and proceeded to take my in-laws and my husband.  We parked a few blocks away and walked through a VERY seedy neighborhood... I was extremely thankful it was broad daylight and had two men with me!  We got to this location and were surprised that it is a walk-up counter in a very dirty room.  We asked about seating and were directed outside and back in a different door, covered with bars, and saw three booths next to a pick-up window.  I did not want to sit down on those booths, much less order.  Needless to say we quickly left and were thankful to make it back to the car before someone had broken into it!  So I cannot comment on the food quality, but the neighborhood and the "restaurant" itself were extremely less than desirable.  Just a warning to any other unsuspecting people who read these "five star" reviews and want to know what this place really looks like!

23.description: Ohhohoho. Capri Pizza is an institute. If you're from the south side, you know it to be the best. And it is. Their pizza is the. best. thin. crust. you will ever eat. And their broasted chicken? I love it. And I hate fried chicken. I know, it's odd, but I do.. but I will eat Capri's chicken. You just have to eat there, plain and simple. It's a take out service or delivery, but really. My mouth is literally watering at the memory of their pizza. So much cheesy goodness to be had.

5.description: You won't find a better pizza place in South Chicago. I grew up on this pizza and sometimes drive all the way from the west suburbs for this pizza. Love the thin crust pizza.

31.description: truly great pizza, to find pizza this good on the far southside is amazing. the thin crust is good, and the deep dish is awesome. I stand by the original of cheese and sausage, but i have had a variety of toppings from italian beef, black olives, onions, to gardinera peppers, pepperoni and green peppers.also, the hot wings are good, the broasted chicken can be a hit or miss depending on if it was fried too hard or not, but when its on, it's dead on.

25.description: Pizza Capri is simple, fresh, well prepared food... It is definitely the gem of the dismal Hyde Park eateries. The pizza is awesome. They have a nice wine list, good specials, nice service for a simple family restaurant. It's nothing fancy, but it's a great place to have a decent meal on the south side (a rare compliment).

12.description: I've tried so hard to not fly off the handle every time (which ends up being almost every time I order from here) my order is wrong but what happened tonight was the last straw. Who is responsible for managing this place?! I just blew $50 plus a $10 tip (delivery) on something that is so wrong it almost seems like a cruel terrible joke. I am not the only person who has had this problem and it seriously seems like no one cares, I really hope some sort of management responds to this and has the common courtesy to apologize to me. I don't even care about the money, just call me and pretend like you care at all, because the truth is we all know you don't. The history of mistakes is undeniable and the lack of professionalism has reached a new low, please train YOUR staff!!!!! If you do respond (and I hope you do) I will give you every detail of my horrendous experience today. Thank you for your time and to any potential customers reading this, the food is good, but order something ridiculously simple, pick it up in person, and open it BEFORE you pay. Don't be like so many of us who have been disappointed over and over again.

37.description: If you're in the South Chicago area you can never go wrong by getting a bite to eat at Capri Pizza.  They've been in business at this location since 1955.  Their whole menu is great.  The pizza is like none other.  Every pizza is made fresh to order.  They have daily specials and also lunch specials.  The beef sandwiches are the bomb always fully stacked with italian beef and made fresh to order.  I like mine toasted with melted mozzarella cheese, red sauce and hot peppers.  Their hot peppers are oven rosted daily.  Yumm!!!  Try the place out.... the food is great and the prices are very reasonable.

21.description: I have always enjoyed this pizza place, hidden gem on the south east side of Chicago. I have never been disappointed or unsatisfied with my order.

16.description: Use to be good.  Not worth it anymore.  Order clerk I talked to doesn't pay attention and gets address wrong all the time.  Also prices are too high for poor pizza.

17.description: I have always enjoyed this pizza place, hidden gem on the south east side of Chicago. I have never been disappointed or unsatisfied with my order.

10.description: UPDATE: After giving this place more chances  i am no longer a customer! i haven't personally ordered from this place in a year or so because they always screw up my orders. However, my sister still orders pizza from here so since it was convenient, i ate.. but it is frustrating when they repeatedly get orders wrong when the person taking your order repeats and confirms your order. You cant screw up an XL sausage/pep/EXTRA mushrooms/jalapenos! this isnt a special request! and it is most definitely NOT rocket science. Are these people incompetent?i had absolutely no mushrooms on this pizza and got onion instead. This business needs to hire new managers/employees because they cant ever get any orders correct. They cant even things as simple as the sauces for wings correct. i reached out to them and still haven't heard from them which tells me they don't care.in the past they have offered to fix their mistakes for free but why would i want to wait an additional hour for them to fix it? i have counter offered to save that free pizza for another time and they have said that i had to do it that day to get if for free. If i get the pizza free today why cant i get it another day? it is the same difference. why inconvenience your customers?Its never about the issue thats the issue, the issue is how they handle it.

11.description: Absolutely love this place, you can't go wrong with anything! Sausage pizza? The best. Fried chicken? The best. Italian beef? One of the best. Heck even the fries are great! If you're ever hosting a party, watching the game or just don't feel like cooking then you NEED to call Capri, I guarantee you will not be disappointed.

26.description: By far the best pizza in Chicago. Great prices too. I am willing to drive long and far to get a slice. I am not a big fan of chicken, but I can tell you that their broasted chicken is the best chicken I have ever had.

27.description: Love this Pizza place. They have great pizza and ribs. They are courteous and I have been ordering from them since 2003. Love you Capris. :)

35.description: OK, so if you're from S.Chicago or the East Side you know there's only one place to get great thin crust Pizza.  In fact when family and friends say, "who wants pizza?" no one even asks from where, you automatically know it's Capri's.  It's like the heaven's opened up  and an XL thin crust w/ sausage and cheese fell out of the sky. Seriously it's that good.  My husband and I are even pizza snobs now.  We never eat at chain pizza restaurants like Domino's, Pizza Hut and Little Cesar's. we would rather have our intestines taken out and wrapped around the tailpipe of a truck going down Calumet Avenue. When ordering pizza make sure to get fries. Oh ya, and  ask them for hot sauce. Yes, I know hot sauce on pizza and fries? I must be joking right? Wrong. Here in the East Side/ S.Chicago area we like hot sauce on are fries AND pizza. And not just any hot sauce, it has to be Hector's Hot Sauce (or as it's referred to Heine's- but that's a whole other review). My North Side and Indiana friends look at us crazy when we bring out our neon orange hot sauce. But after they try it, they love it. There is also an Indiana Capri right off of Calumet Avenue.  That one offers the same high quality pizza as the one in South Chicago.  A word to the wise: It has the best regular pizza not Deep dish or Stuffed whatever you want to call it.  That pizza is just a chunk of bead with some sauce. Stay far away from that.

8.description: Just left Capri Pizza absolutely love this pizza I got a large  chesse, spinach, mushrooms, chiclen, everything was fresh , customer service was great. This will be my new Pizza Place .

0.description: Love their pizza and chicken also their pasta is good, that's one place we always go back to , great for parties they have a lot of good things on their menu so I really recommend this place !!!!!!!!!!!

20.description: I dont know what is going on with Capri pizza, but something has changed. I ordered my usual, large sausage, extra sauce,  and peppers, when I got home, no extra sauce, sparse peppers,  and somewhat bland. Naturally I assumed they had an off night. The next time I ordered, I shared my unpleasant experience with the young lady taking the order. She assured me it was just an off night. I placed my same order. When I arrived to pick up my order, I was informed she failed to add extra sauce to the order.  As I was talking to the cashier,  the owner walked up.  I explained what happened, he sorta frowned at me, said he would talk to her, and started writing new orders.  No apology,  or refund for the ingredient left off my pizza.  I did not feel like arguing over 85 cent, so I left.  When I got home, I was not impressed. Barely any peppers on the pizza and less sausage  on my pizzas than the last twenty years. I am now looking for a new pizza spot. To add insult to injury,  they recently went up on their prices. I can no longer recommend this establishment.

19.description: I love this pizza, it's as good as it gets. Good price, the sauce is on point, and when delivered, it's always hot and fresh. I've been eating pizza from here since I was a kid, and it has always been consistently good. The staff and delivery guys are nice as well.

33.description: When we go visit friends in the south side a Capri pizza is a must, It's the one thing I miss from that area, since we moved It's just a little too far away now to go often.

2.description: Should've listened to new reviews this place gets my order on the phone I repeated like about 5 times and they still get it wrong disappointed!!!! Now to eat something I didn't order because it's closed and I can't get ahold of no!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I will be calling tomorrow!!! Oh and to top it off it was even cooked right!

34.description: Tried it for the first time last week. Its not bad , although I have had much better. State line pizza in Hammond Indina for one. I ordered  and waited. Capri does do a lot of buisness.

32.description: Everyone on this side of town (S. Chicago, S. Deering, E. Side) knows about this place.  They have some of the best pizza in the area.  Their broasted chicken is pretty good too.  They have daily specials M - Thurs.Their beef or sausage sandwiches are delicious with optional peppers but i'm not too hip to the meatball for some reason.They have pasta (mostaccioli, spaghetti, ravioli) and appetizers (buffalo wings, poppers, zucchini)They have ribs too but i'd only order them only if you really have a taste for ribs. They are meaty but a little bland and loaded with bbq sauce.Lastly, they do offer catering and it is worth ordering for sure.

18.description: So this place is an oldie but a goodie. This is the best pizza on the southeast side...let me paint the picture. Back then Capri was always just kinda so-so, a thick thin kinda crust, and a generic type of sauce; you know the type I'm talking for kids taste, if that makes any sense. Anyway about a month ago I was feeling kinda nostalgic and ordered, of course not expecting anything mind blowing. All I can say was wow. Tastier, cheesier, richer and seasoned better. I don't know if they changed or tweaked the recipe a bit but it is definitely for the best. Way to go and keep up the good work. You have revived an old customer...

13.description: Probably one of my favorite pizza places. They can be a bit greasy, but is one great pie. The boasted chicken, and pizza combo is the way to go for a Friday night in with a couple of movies friends or family.

4.description: This place used to be very good. Now they cut corners and cheap it out. You need to travel out of this neighborhood to find good pizza. The Capri in Whiting Indiana is slightly better. If people keep buying this lousy pizza, then they have no reason to improve. We live in the greatest pizza city in the country. If you think this is good pizza, then you need to get out of this neighborhood and try some of the other truly delicious pizza places around the city that deserve your patronage (Salernos, Peace, DiNella's, Lou Malnati's, Pizano).

24.description: A little hidden gem on the southeast side of Chicago. Pizza is consistently good and priced right. I've never had a bad pizza from this place.

6.description: This used to be my favorite pizza place... Every time that I wanted to get my pizza fix, Capri's was the place to go. But guess what, not anymore. Not after the multiple bad customer service experiences I've had at this location. Once I even ordered for pick-up and the rude lady working the counter said that they never got our order. I won't miss this pizza especially when they don't even serve fresh ingredients. I hate canned mushrooms on my pizza!

22.description: For a long time, Capri Pizza has always been a treat to me!! Their ingredients are fresh! The pizza dough has always been made from scratch! And, their "world-famous" broasted chicken has always been the best a la carte with the pizza! Capri Pizza, in my opinion, has always been a "thumbs up" while Pizza Hut and Domino's are a "thumbs down." I just hope they never go out of business!! Bon apetit!!

15.description: Love their pizza!! And the broasted chicken is really good. I would  recommend  this place!

7.description: Great pizza. Sauce is sweet & tangy.  Price is very reasonable compared to others of a quality pizza. Only issue is with coupons that I did not get to use from valpak. They do not have an expiration on them but was informed they are not honoring them anymore. Come on now. Its only 4.00. Give me a break! Especially when I have given them free advertisement. I have gotten them a few new customers & have been ordering from them over 20 years. Ive been loyal now we fall out over a coupon...hmmmm really. Pizza places are PLENTIFUL. KEEP it up & one of your comp etitors are going to WIN ME OVER. Capri nite will have another name. Well Home Run inn here we come!

36.description: I've been eating Capri's Pizza since forever....there have been numerous  other big franchise pizza places (Pizza Hut, Domino's) try to come into the neighborhood and they never last. They were all run out of town with their tails between their legs. This is a South Chicago staple. Their pizza is amazing, best with a side of french fries. Also their spaghetti and meatballs is also great.

30.description: Hands down the BEST pizza in Chicago I mean in the world.  Established in the late 1940's by Tony Ciannamea...more than 60 years later Capri is still the strongest and most authentic, a true staple of Chicago's southside.  You will fall in love with Capri at your very first bite, guaranteed.  : D

3.description: They really deserve no stars. New owners nothing like the quality of food we grew up on. Prices are high for below average pizza and fish.

14.description: What can I say about my all time fave pizza joint? It's usually very tasty( I've had a few misses) but they make it exactly how you want. Delivery n service are usually pretty standard and prices are always decent. If you live in the area and want yummy pizza delivered go with capri....word to the wise I would NEVER go pick it up, that area is so sketchy I wouldn't go there with my cop brother....just saying.

3.description: This place was damn good.  I got the steak burrito and the whole thing was so freakin tasty and the steak is cooked right.  I had the fried pork (Carnitas) Gordita and man was it good as hell, I highly recommend the gordita here, my brother had a El Pastor one and he said is some good shit too!  I will definately be back and it is a sigh of relief after eating at nasty TNT down the street a while back.

1.description: Hmmmmm I don't know where to begin with this place. I think this place is actually really good but I only gave it two stars instead of four because of the customer service. If your not Mexican you will not receive a warm greeting even if you give one. I walked in and said hello and it being my first time there the cook just walked right pass me without any acknowledgement or anything so I just stood there till he ask he what did I want. Which is exactly what he said but when his Mexican buddies came in they got the what up amigos and a smile... Um why couldn't I get that???? Another black person came in after me and straight attitude again. Ugh that disgusted me if you don't want black ppl in your store, put up a sign so I can sue. Just rude. But never the less I ordered a steak burrito from here and it was delicious. It had beans, seasoned to perfection steak, lettuce, tomato and cheese that was all rolled up inside if a tortilla. It didn't come with fries or anything, I assume you had to order that separately if you wanted it but whatever. Over all it was really good food from what I had bit I don't think I would be back because of the awful customer service. I don't pay people to treat me like crap. So I can't pay them even though their food was delicious..7/16/15Everyone: please look at the picture that I posted that someone sent me and you will understand my response So I am NOT changing a single thing that I wrote in response to how I felt when I walked into this establishment..but I will response to Arthur R. From Lansing sent he felt it was his responsibility to correct me on my opinion and my feelings since he is obviously an African American young lady named Tamara (I didn't know I had an exact replica of myself but cool!!!) even though it's none of your business how I paid for my food, but a co-worker paid for me that day because we needed a quick bite to eat and it was her turn to buy lunch.. So therefore No I did not pay for my meal and Yes it was DELICIOUS. What does Bill Cosby have to do with anything? I don't know him and he don't know me?I NEVER claimed anyone in there to be a racist, I just wanted a warm greeting like every Latino that walked in there. Since you said most black people don't know how to act in the inner city including me. you don't know me or my demeanor. Don't judge me by other peoples actions judge me for me. I had a smile on my face, I was properly dressed given the fact that I was working, and I spoke proper English.. So why can't I get a simple hi?? Yes I did say if they don't want black people in their store to put up a sign so I can sue and I stand by it!! By the way that goes for any place I visit. Have I been back since that review?? yes I have.. did I pay for anything?? No I did not.Did I steal anything? No I did not. I just happen to have a coworker who like the place. Last time I checked Money is GREEN and that's the only color I know and it all spends the same and finally I am the consumer that wanted to buy a product and No I didn't need to spend my Hard Earn Money on someplace that cannot say hi to me and everyone in there spoke perfectly good English and Spanish so there were No language barrier..Now I don't need to explain myself to you or anyone else for that matter Arthur R. From Lansing IL. But I took the time to respond to your ignorance about me and how I felt because I forgot I guess I don't me or my emotions and a complete stranger that I never meet knows me better then I know myself.. Keep the nonsense to yourself and thank you for reading.. At least I know my reviews are being read.. #NeverOnThatLevel.. Who the real racist.. Not me so I guess that's you.yelp please don't delete this, let other people learn from his stupid mistake. #ImAboveTheNegativeFacebookTwitterInstagram Can all get a good laugh

2.description: Kinda sketchy area, but the burrito con pollo that I ordered was really good and well worth the price. CASH ONLY. I thought that it was really good, and I am glad that I decided to go there.

5.description: GORDITAS!This is a grocery store that has a little lunch counter. Gorditas are damn good and one ($2.35 each) fills me up. Every once in a while I like to try out my Spanish but lately I've been ordering in English because I'm chicken.And no, white boy, those red and yellow bottles are not ketchup and mustard.*pictures

6.description: Delicious! I visited from Tucson AZ and am used to Sonoran style food. This place was awesome. I loved the way the carne asada was so finely chopped and well seasoned.  I had a taco and a gordita and wanted to try the chicharron and adobada but was too full. I liked the sour cream, and although we use cabbage and not lettuce, it was a good combination. The Agua de Melon could have been a little sweeter but I will definitely eat here again when I am in the area.

7.description: Mmmmmmmmm.....Try a gordita de lengua and a torta de milanesa.  So good and super cheap!  Friendly gentlemen behind the counter who call everyone "primo"(spanish for cousin) :)

8.description: EXCELLENT GORDITAS, you must try, you have no idea what your missing, this place is truly a gem.

0.description: Do you like tacos, gorditas, burritos, and tortas?! Are you looking for the best of these in the entire city of Chicago?!Well you're going to need to come out to South Chicago and get yourself ANYTHING from El Guero's food stand! BUT, this spot is cash only. So don't forget that key piece of information.Their service is quick, the cooks are friendly, and all the food is made as you order it. You can, however, call in to place your order to get your food quicker. If you do this, I'd suggest you eat there because the food doesn't travel too well in the aluminum foil it gets wrapped.Now, on to the food! The meat is just plain delicious, no matter what you get. Personally, I'm more of a fan of carne asada and theirs stands above the rest that I've tasted throughout the city. They have a decent variety of meat, which is good so you don't get overwhelmed with too many options. You can get carne asada, al pastor, chicken, chorizo and a few others.To drink, they have your typical canned pop as well as bottles, as well as water. But, if you really want to enjoy your food, you simply cannot skip out on the agauas frescas! I'd suggest the horchata, which in my opinion, goes head to head that of Lalo's. They also have pineapple water and jamaica.To sum it up, this is absolutely the best Mexican fast food spot in the city.

4.description: Hands down, THE BEST tacos and gorditas in South Chicago!Quick, friendly service. CASH ONLY. Takes orders ahead of time over the phone for minimal waiting. Delicious homemade salsas to accompany your food and a variety of different kinds of meat (carne asada, al pastor, chicken, chorizo, etc.). You can your tacos with either cilantro and onion or lettuce, tomato, onion, cheese, but I recommend getting it with cilantro and onion.Also, the aguas frescas are THA BOMB DOT COM! Their horchata (rice water) is PERFECTION and the agua de melon is THE antidote for a nasty hangover! p.s. this place DOES deliver but to businesses ONLY and for a minimum amount $15 in food. \CASH ONLY, people!

3.description: I really want to love this--the meat is solid and I love the convenience of delivery and online ordering. But for the last four times I've had deliveries, the company has not delivered during my requested time. Usually they call a few hours before the delivery window and tell you that they are coming the next day, instead, which is really inconvenient if you planned to be home that day to receive the delivery.  I had a delivery scheduled for yesterday, got the call that they were coming today from 3-6p, and got a call at 11:30 am, saying that they were coming in the next hour or two, before the delivery window!  Unless you are at home CONSTANTLY, this is crazy!  I called customer service and they cut me off when I told them the situation.  I am giving one more chance here, but the next time they mess up, it's over.  Too bad they can't get the delivery process right--convenience is the whole point!!

1.description: First timer & got burnedFor 3.65lb of chicken ordered, actual quantity received was 1.87lb, For 10lb of goat, actual quantity received was 8lb.On talking to their customer service, I was told "may be the bird (chicken) which I got was too small" & the goat should have been atleast 9lb.I should have received approximate quantity irrespective of bird being small or big.Failed my expectation, going back to B&M stores.

2.description: You know what they say about the first impression? Well this company made a horrible one! I ordered online on a Wednesday and a little while later was told that I would be getting my delivery on Saturday instead of Friday because they were having some refrigeration issues. I told the lady I wouldnt be home so she was like Monday evening. Monday Morninf get a call saying it will be Tuesday because they aren't delivering Monday...that's it, that was the excuse! Tuesday I get a confirmation that it will be coming after 7PM. I get a call around 6 that the delivery man will be there in 20 minutes. Well I wasnt home because I was told after 7! Luckily someone was home and so I got the delivery, when I opened it, their was writing on the inside of the box that 1 item was missing and out of stock! Noone had said anything to me about this at any point!  Any apology I got throughout this ordeal from the people on the phone was so generic and pathetic. There was no genuine concern or sympathy and they were the ones that screwed up. I will not order from these people again. They customer service was so below standards and the apologies made me even more mad. They said nothing to make the situation better for me as a customer, they must not care about their reputation and image. Well I'll be letting my friends and family know and you readers should also be prepared!!

5.description: We used their 'We Grill You Chill' service where they come on-site and BBQ.  Everything was excellent.  Food was great, service was awesome.  Would highly recommend.

0.description: A year later, and I must say that they have greatly improved on customer service!! They do make mistakes here and there but I order from them often enough that it's expected and they always do what they can to correct it. They even make follow up calls the day after delivery to see if everything was ok with the order so you don't have to worry about maybe forgetting to call about a mix up. I definitely respect a company who works at improving!!

4.description: I had placed an order with taaza2u for my daughter's graduation party for 20 people and was expecting the delivery the night before for a BBQ on Thursday. The day before the scheduled delivery on Wednesday I received a call from a woman saying they can't deliver and did not even apologize. I asked to speak to a manager but she said she is the customer service. I then received a call from a man who was apologizing and he would send me a free sampler (which of course I never received). I was extremely disappointed because I was informed last minute and had to prepare the night before my daughter's graduation for a lunch of 20 people without any prior notice. I found their customer service to be completely unprofessional. Would not recommend them due to them being unapologetic and unreliable.

3.description: Hello tasty nibblers out there! I wanted to write about my favorite Chinese delivery place near my home. It is HUA'S Open Kitchen.  Located right next door to Gomez Tacos in near South Chicago. One of my favorite delivery options is Chinese takeout and Hua' s gives you a FREE egg roll or soda with $10.00 or more or  a FREE Small Shrimp Fried Rice with $20.00 or more purchase. The portions are large and I save mine for lunch the next day. I always order from their special combination plate section on the back of the menu. Almost all combos are $5.50 or less! They include 2 pc Crab Rangoon or 1 Egg Roll and a Shrimp Fried Rice or White rice with any of the following entrees: Vegetable Delight, Szechwan Beef or Chicken, Orange Chicken, Sweet and Sour Chicken, Pepper Steak, Shrimp Chop Suey, General Tso's Chicken. Kung Po Chicken, Mongolian Beef/Chicken, Shrimp Egg Foo Young (2), Fried Chicken Wings (6 pc) and my favorite Chicken with Cashew Nuts!The Chicken with Cashews was great. The gravy was not too thick and had a very light taste of soy.  It was more vegetable stock and plum sauce. It had a good mix of nuts to veggies which I like. Over all a good dish with lots of zucchini and carrots!I bet you to try and compare HUA's with Kwan's and you will see the difference. Call right now at 773-375-1800.Sample MenuBeef Fried Rice 5.25 lgKung Po Chicken 7.25 lgEgg Drop Soup 2.75Pot Stickers (6) 3.95Seafood Lo Mein 8.50 lgThere hours are Mon- Thursday 11 am - 9:30 pmFri and Saturday 11 am - 10 pmSunday 12 pm - 9:00 pmRemember Kwan's is closed on Monday.

1.description: I actually do like this place. The prices are right and the food is delicious and the portions are huge! I have yet to be disappointed from this place and I do hope that I never will be. Today I ordered the crab ragoon, which was a lot that I shocked myself when I couldn't finish it all. That's a sad day in my eating history. I always finish my crab ragoon but not today I guess. I also had the fried shrimp, which I come to realize that I am not a fan of. It was good, but it was more of a medium size shrimp that had been overly breaded took fool the eye into thinking that your eating a large or extra large shrimp when your not. So that was disappointing, it was good but not as good as I thought it would be. I also had the shrimp fried rice which was cooked to perfection and the shrimp and broccoli dish which was also good, However my only complaint is that the broccoli could have been cooked more. It was just a little too under done.I am going through a no meat phase in my life so this is why you see all of these seafood dishes plus I am a true fan of seafood so its ok. Overall this is my spot on the southside if I am ever looking for some good Chinese food.

2.description: I love love love this place and I was so upset that I moved out of the delivery area...but I will take the drive just to get their orange chicken wings...oh just the thought of these big flavorful wings makes me do my signature happy dance...and you would have thought I found gold when I found an old menu from this place because I had lost my phone which meant I didn't have the number and because I always got my food via delivery I had never been to the establishment so I am so happy and I will be going there for sure this weekend.Since, I have only experienced this pace via delivery that is what my review will be on as well as the food.It was fast and the driver was always so nice and pleasant even when one day I had 4 dollars in change.Besides the orange chicken wings they have great egg rolls, crab ragoon,shrimp and lobster sauce, egg foo young, Mongolian chicken, and they also have special combo plates so if my experience is just as good when I step into the doors of this place as it was when they delivered...I will give them 5 stars because they deserve it!

0.description: Omg, how did I not review this place yet? The food is cheap and awesome. They have the best crab Rangoon and General Tso's chicken around, with generous portions. And they're friendly on top of that. And fast. We don't have any papers or anything, but we're practically married.

3.description: Well I see why there are only two other reviews, and also why the place was empty when we arrived.  This place has a terrible set up and it reminds you of a depressing mini banquet hall.  The staff sits at tables and stare right out at you as they eat their own food and fold napkins etc....how tacky!  But seriously I do not give a shit about that it's really all about the food, I just wanted to point out how bizarre of a set up they have and how they have not cleaned up the gang graffiti in the bathroom like ever!  The bathroom is saturated in graffiti from every gang in the South Chicago neighborhood.  The fact that it was not cleaned up just shows that they do not care and have given up, and that the place is gang turf and not their own business.Now it is time to get to the food, the single most important thing that can make one forget about to depressing decor, the gang graffiti, the awkward stare downs of the staff facing you while you eat and they eat and fold napkins is the food.  The food can be a saving grace for places like this that fail in set up and decor, but in this case, nope.First we got the complementary chips and salsa, or should I say store bought type chips with spicey ketchup.  The salsa was very spicey and burned with spiciness; however, the taste was just like the crappy store bought B.S. you get from the store like Pace or Tostidos, it was jsut not good.  For the first time we actually had an empty chips basket and still half of the salsa.  When the waitress asked if we wanted more chips and salsa I declined.  I ordered the steak burrito and two tacos to sample one with El Pastor and one with the pork stew; however, I never recieved the El pastor taco which was good for two reasons; first, I was full from the burrito and other taco so I was in over my head, second, my brother ordered the El Pastor taco and he said it was horrible.  Well my pork stew taco was tasteless, so they did not make the meat right.  My brother said his chicken enchiladas were not that bad and he said the beans were not bad either.  Now as for my burrito........geez........well the waitress brought it out and cautioned me that the plate was really hot, OMG red flag!  When you are at a regular Mexican restaurant and they nuke your plate it means they probably nuked your food too.........yup, they sure as hell did.  See, they wanted to have melted cheese on top of the burrito, so they figured they would sprinkle it on then nuke it for awhile, ahhhhhhh!  That is horrible!  The steak in the burrito was a little tasty but dried out thanks to the microwave, hey do not look at me, I did not order melted cheese on top this is their normal practice!  Also to mention the first bites of the burrito burned my tongue and the roof of my mouth from the heat.  That is NOT supposed to happen when eating a burrito.  Let me think of the last time a burrito burned me, uuuummmm, never!  There was also rice inside the burrito which usually ticks me off, especially since it was rice and peas which is a Puerto Rican idea, well the garlicy rice was actually good.  My brother liked his rice too, in fact, it was the best thing they served!  Well half way through my burrito I found it laboreous to keep eating it yet I forced myself, the meat was just too frickin dry!  Finally we were done with our aweful meal and left with a dissatisfied feeling and a burned, numb tongue, I will never return here, but hey, $4.50 for the burrito I guess you get what you pay for, well I would rather pay another $1.50 elsewhere and get good quality.

1.description: I came here a few years ago and the food was pure trash. The steak tasted like a foreign  animal. My ex husband and I walked out and didn't EVER EAT there again!

2.description: I've come to this restaurant since I was a child. It's very low key and sometimes hard to find. I have to admit I order the same thing every time but that's because it's amazing! (Chorizo with papas and eggs) My friends have ordered other things on the menu and have said it's so-so. The staff is friendly and pretty fast. Decent spot for the area.

5.description: Yummmm...yes, this place is pretty divey with the plastic-coated table clothes and sparse decor. But the food is delicious and inexpensive. The chorizo on the taco was perfect, not too salty but full of flavor. Get the horchata  - it's fantastic. My only complaint are the chips and salsa - the chips were stale and the salsa was too spicy for enjoyment (and I like spicy food). I'll be back :)

0.description: I was actually told not to come here.  My friend  told me the food was awful.  And why did I come anyway?  Because she recommended another place which ended up sucking, so I just assumed she had bad taste.And she probably does.  But now I know that if *she* dislikes something, it must be really bad.When I walked in around noon on a chilly Tuesday, the first thing I thought was "Where am I?" Because it was dark.  I waited a few moments for my eyes to adjust to the lighting, and was able to make out a few things.  A couple morosely staring down at their tablecloths, looking as if they were breaking up.  Two middle aged men in wife beaters, with numerous tattoos all over their arms; they looked at me as if I were interrupting something important.  Broken Christmas lights strung around the entire room.  Iron bars over the tiny windows, which barely let in any light.  And a suprisingly perky waitress who smiled at me and immediately put me at ease.  She's the reason TNT gets two stars instead of one.So how does naive little AK interpret this scene, you ask?  How rustic and adorable.  Clearly people aren't here for the ambiance.  They must be here for the food.  It's probably authentic and amazing!After being asked if I was from the health department and assuring them I wasn't, I was seated next to the a window, right next to the hot neon sign that announced "open" to those on the sidewalk.  Twenty minutes later, the waitress remembered me and came to ask me if I wanted a drink.  Twenty minutes after that, she got my meal order. Thirty minutes after that, she brought me my tacos.  And when I bit into my chorizo taco, the first thing I thought was that this DIDN'T taste like bad Mexican food; it tasted like bad Indian food.  The "steamed" tortilla was dry, crispy, and had visible burn marks.  It tasted like a day old burnt chapati.  The chorizo was mixed in some chunky sauce that tasted a lot like the brown mystery cream of the sort of generic "chicken curry" you find at an all-you-can-eat Indian buffet.  I had asked for green sauce.  When she brought me red sauce, I tried to explain myself more clearly, but she assured me that the sauce she brought me was correct. "That's green."  I must be colorblind.    Maybe it's the lighting.  But wait, there is something green in here.  Something slimy.  Something that won't be speared by my fork.  Wait, is it?  It is.  It's an OKRA.  wtf?I left my tacos with an ample pity tip and left.

4.description: The bathrooms are full of gang graffiti. The staff stares at you while they are eating on the dining room floor. All the food had shortcut after shortcut, and it was all microwaved. The wait staff screwed up half of my order. The all pastor tasted old. The carne asada was dry and old. The beans had a hard skin on them from the microwave. The salsa tasted store-bought and bland. The only edible thing was the rice.

1.description: This place is a cute little place. They have a bar next door. I definitely prefer this place to olive garden. The portions are huge. Its by my house so its convenient. Entrees are no more than $15.

0.description: I live in South Chicago and Roma's has been around for a long time. We recently went and had a good experience. I had the fettuccini Alfredo and the portion was massive. My mom had the lemon chicken and enjoyed it. Overall food was good and service was decent. The bar is connected to the restaurant and I could hear the Bears getting their ass kicked, besides being a Bears fan everything else was great.

This is a nice clean and well stocked!! store and the Pharmacy is nice and Thorough as far as cross checking for interaction of different meds also will try to save you a few dollars with something maybe OTC.

3.description: If I want a quick turkey burger or a sub, then Carl's is the spot!  My kids love the chicken wings with mild sauce......not the healthiest meal, but they swear by it!  Subs, hot dogs, Super tacos...all with a smile and pretty quick service.  Not bad for a fast food joynt!

1.description: I was a regular at Carl's 50 years ago, but now its across the street and the old ladies with hair nets are long gone. It was a nice blast from the past and you can't ruin a Vienna Polish with mustard and onions. Food was good but its a different vibe.

2.description: Quick review for a quick bite.I needed a quick bite before a church event, so I stopped by Carl's Red Hots. My first mind told me to get a polish and fries, but I got the fries and tamales instead. Big mistake. The tamales were not made by Carl's and were not even close to good tamales...please stop selling this! The fries were good, hot and yummy.I give Carl's one extra star for great customer service even when there were loud kids around, the place was clean for a food joint, and it was warm inside the lobby for their customers. Prices were good overall.Maybe one day I can re-visit and get a Red Hot or a polish.

5.description: Reasonable prices, quick service, good food and not a whole lot of attitude from the employees!!! I definitely recommend this place; especially after a night of drinking! LOL!

6.description: Great food for when you're in a rush to get lunch.  Super specials, as well as quick service.  I really like coming here because it has a variety of different food (I'm a fan of the hot dogs!) and it even has a drive through!  I'll be seeing a lot of Carl's this school year!

7.description: I grew up with Carl's Red Hots since the 60's. I remember the wonderful greasy bags of fries and the wonderful dogs and the orange Nehi. I was of course only like 10 years old but my memories are wonderful. I do miss their old shack across the street of the current location. Something about eating in a little shack

0.description: I am 75 year old.  Carl's Red Hots Stand was my first job in 1955.  I loved working for  Carl and Mr. Siegel.  (he was so sweet)  He would have this saying...."If you know what I mean."  I remember him always looking over his eyeglasses.  Smile..  One time, I a friend stopped by the stand to see me...I gave him a free hot dog.  One of the customers saw this and told on me.  Carl was so kind and told me how he made this his living and I should not give it away.  I cried but he forgave me.  I had a greater sense of respect for working hard and be honest.  He taught me how to forgive and forget.  He never brought it up again.    We sold nothing but Red Hots with fries for .25 cents, cold drinks and hot tamales.   At that time, I made 75 cents an hour...and I saved enough to buy my Senior Prom Dress...$50.  Which was a lot of money back then.  Carl would never let me ride the bus home when I worked closing...he made sure I got home safe.  He drove me to my  home.  Always a very kind and caring man who worked very hard.  I am so glad to hear Carl's Red Hots is still around.  I now live in Phoenix, AZ.  One day I will stop by and have a Red Hot for ole time sake ..hope I get to meet Carl's son.  God Blessings on you.   June Hyman Esposito

4.description: apparently you not only need a sandwich with beef on it but you also need italian sausage. then you need to have this said artery clogger dipped to go along with a bag full of greasy french fries. and then you need to wash it down with a coke. i was unaware of these things that i needed until we made a quick stop at carl's to grab some food...and it was a very good idea. the sandwich was awesome but this is not for the waistline watching crowd. you just have to suck it up that you've gained 1lb just by looking at the menu and 5lbs when finishing this delicious meal. and the prices are well within reason so at least your wallet doesn't take a hit!

29.description: I love this restaurant...they have live music, great waitresses & the best of it all FAST SERVICE!!

42.description: MMM good. Food is flavorful and fresh. I go there maybe 2-3 times per month for a quick, healthy bite.  Love their tortas & long island ice tea. Service is good and food is pretty authentic. This is my local, late hour, spot with parking.

23.description: I'm positive that this is the best restaurant in the area. The food is excellent and truly authentic. The ambiance isn't fancy but it is pleasant, and service is decent. They've never missed, and I have been here more than once. Their burrito suizo is unbelievably good.

8.description: Had the tostada camaron with arroz & frijoles and it was amazing. They give you a lot of food for great prices. My best friend got the asada burrito and it was huuuge!

31.description: always crowded.. they make a great taco and nachos. the parking lots always full so it has to be good

34.description: You get what u pay 4!!! The food is very tasty and the sit-down area is ALWAYS busy - so if u go to eat-in, be prepared 2 wait. As far as the service goes, the guy on the register is always friendly. The waitresses may or may not be fluent in English BUT so what, u get a decent meal for a decent price and u can always ask the register guy for help if language becomes barrier. I go back frequently and will continue to do so.

16.description: I love the lemonade here & if you sit in to eat they make the lemonade like a virgin daiquiri. I like the tacos but the steak burrito is my favorite. I took two of my nieces and they loved the steak quesadilla. The salsa is ok but I have had better.

13.description: I went there and ordered something different, breaded shrimp,  I should of stuck to the regular steak or tortas. It was ok but I go there expecting way better, but this time i was disappointed.  To top it off, The waitress was not friendly at all. Next time I'll stick to the regular and carry it out.

11.description: I was just there on Friday and I ordered 3 tacos and a side of rice. It was delicious. I enjoyed the tender steak tacos and rice was full of flavor. I think I will slide by tonight and get a few more. Yum!

39.description: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!! I literally grew up here!!! I've been coming here since I was 14 and it was in a grocery store down the street! I'm 46 now!!! The Carne Asada dinner will make you slap your momma! LOL I've eaten at every single one of their resturants! I love them all! This one and the on on 57th and Pulaski are my favorite. 57th is very pretty and fun on Sun nights with the band! 88th and Commercial is my hood that I grew up in! My husband and I lived here when I was pregnant!

37.description: Want good Mexican Food? Yep! Then check Cocula out! Anytime I have gone to different ones the food has been good. I have to say I was not impressed with the service and atmosphere but I tried to get pass all of that to enjoy the food which I did. The staff doesn't speak a lot of English so pointing to the menu or knowing a little bit of Spanish will go a long way here. I ordered the chorizo tacos and they were delish. Everything tasted and appeared to be fresh. I have been here twice so far and never had any issues.

0.description: Cold winter afternoon , so it's time for a steaming bowl of Mexican chicken soup (caldo de pollo).  La Cocula's caldo was almost as good as mine  Very light chicken broth garnished with a chicken thigh and leg,  boiled potato ,carrots.  chayote, & zucchini .  All that was missing was a piece of corn on the cob. Sprinkled with cilantro , some sliced onion,  & served with Mexican yellow rice and tortillas. It  was just what the doctor ordered.   Solid Mexican restaurant choice on the far Southside.

38.description: I left this place so upset, i will NEVER sit down and eat here again!!!  Usually, i call in my order and pick up my food. This time my brother was with me so we decided to "dine in". First off they give me a menu and the pages were sticky and slimy. I ask a passing by waitress can i get another one bc the one i had was slimy, she gives me a confused look and takes it and never returns with another.  When our waitress finally made an apperance she barely spoke english and i had to repeat and point to what i wanted several times. The food was on point and delicious, that was a non issue. But seriously folks can we get a competent server.  So we are eating our spicy dishes and need refills. I catch our waitress attention several times and she never comes back to the table. What in the world, seriously, we have tacos, enchiladas, spicy salsa and you don't think maybe we might need to cool down our mouths a little...geeshi... Just sayin. Anyway, I stop eating and just conversate with my brother. We continue to sit there and she visits all the other tables except ours. By this time i am ready to go and heated. So i get up and go to the register and ask for my bill. She pops up and asks do i need help, uhhhhh you think, i've been trying to get your attention for the last 20 min but you chose to ignore us. She gives me the bill and asks was everything ok,  um NO!!!!! So in a hurry i pay the bill and we leave. I normally always give tips and give people the benefit of the doubt but today was not the day. I think i need to find a new mexican spot, bc this was seriously RIDICULOUS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

27.description: Some of the BEST Mexican food I've ever had in my entire life. Coming from a hispanic family myself, I feel that's saying a lot. I found this place because it was mentioned in another review by another Yelper. I saw the pictures and was convinced to give it a go. The first time I came here, I got the burrito suiza with the rice and beans, chicken nacho appetizer, fonduta (cheese dip) appetizer, and my boyfriend got an asada (steak) burrito. Everything was so damn good. We were so full we damn near needed a wheelchair to get out of the place. We still had enough leftovers for another entire meal. Since then, we've been back 2-3 more times, and it's been fairly consistent. Definitely a go-to place for some of the best mexican food on the south side of Chicago.ps) I also had the enchiladas...they were decent but not all that. The chorizo fonduta is to die for!GO! Your mouth will thank you.

32.description: I been coming here for years. Always great service and great food.

44.description: YUM! I was in the area for a meeting with a local non-profit and we decided to stop here for lunch - what a delicious surprise! I'm always looking for great Mexican food in the city...and it's hard to find. Cocula had a casual atmosphere and the waitress was super friendly. I think I got the Guadalajara combo...crispy taco, enchilada and chalupa with rice and beans...way too much food, but I wanted to try a little bit of everything. It didn't disappoint! The chips and salsa were also amazing - and prices were even better! Cocula please build another location closer to the South Loop!!

24.description: Cocula is the only place I will eat Mexican food outside of 1 other restaurant, and my home. I'm Mexican and am picky about eating mexican food outside of the house. Cocula is always the best. I love their tortas (though I'm really partial only to their chicken torta or avocado torta; cus I'm weird and dont care much for red meat). Their horchata too! It's the best, and sometimes I'll just go in for that. And their prices are really on point. Most favorite thing on their menu? Their caldo de siete mares (7 seas fish soup). Waitresses are always kind and attentive as well.

7.description: Plenty of parking at this South Chicago restaurant with a lot of food for the price. We had four people in our party and we could have fed twice that.The menu was large. It is a Mexican cuisine and the selections were fantastic! T

40.description: The scene: I'm hungry, and my taste buds are asking for something with a little Mexican flair! What do I do? I either cook something up myself or have my Mom whip something for me! Or, I head on over to Cocula's on Commercial!Yes, they are a local Chicago chain but believe me, this is the BEST one. I don't know what the cooks do here that's different, but the food is just better at this particular location than than the other ones.This is one of my favorite restaurants in my area! Their food is really good, and always hits the spot! I'm obessesed with their steak fajita dinner, tortas, seafood, and drinks! Their horchata is especially good, as well as their limonadas (try it, they bring it you in this huge glass goblet and its like a limeade slushi). They also have a good selection of imported Mexican beers and tequilas, and are open 'til about 3:30a.m.! How can you go wrong? Lately, I've been ordering their "Combinacion" dinners which is the #4 (a tostada, enchilada, and a taco, with your choice of meat. I prefer the the tostada and the taco be picadillo and the enchilada be chicken! and have the tostada be brought you on the side so that it doesn't get soggy!). Ahh yes, another South Chicago staple reviewed on Yelp!

30.description: This restaurant has quality Mexican grub. There aren't too many options where I work, so it's worth the twenty min drive to pick up some tort as here.

46.description: 3.5 starsThis is our go-to place in the 'hood when celebrating with a group. Their margaritas and pina coladas are pretty good. I usually get a burrito but today I had the carne asada taco dinner (yep, had it for lunch). I definitely have enough leftovers lunch the next day. Can't really go wrong with any of the dinners/combos.It's always nice to have a spanish speaker in the group but it's not necessary. The waitresses even played a birthday song for me on the jukebox and a friend kindly translated it;)

1.description: I was on the hunt for menudo because I always seem to be wanting that, but "timing" is often off and likes to play games with me!  In other words, menudo is an item that's typically offered on Saturdays and Sundays only.  As a retail professional, having to work on the entire weekends is just what the business demands.  However, I was "awarded" for having a Saturday off.  In order to prepare this "menudo" feast, I counseled the Google search engine.  I found out that the menudo from  "Cocula Restaurant" was top-rated in Chicago.  This time, Mr. Timing was on our side since hubby was finishing up a service call in Highland, Indiana.  I suggested him to come here for lunch.  Haha, he took the bait!  Where Cocula Restaurant is located isn't in the best hood, yet it's not definitely the worst I've seen in Chicago.  Many of you may disagree with me on this point that I'm about to make: I don't mind citizens drinking in public or using illegal substances on middle of the streets.  You may pursue your happiness whatever way you desire, but the consequences and responsibilities are on you.  That's how libertarian I am as an individual.  Well, let's delve into the food that we consumed happily in Cocula.  Parking is more than plenty, so you stay safe there, my friend (and police do pop in a lot to place orders).Menu from Cocula was one of the most extensive ones I've ever seen.  They had an entire page of Mariscos!  While trying my best to not be distracted by my BFF (seafood), I stuck with my original choice, menudo.  On the other hand, hubby requested chilaquiles with huevo only without any meat.  The service was attentive.  The young lady even asked if I preferred my menudo with or without bones!  I usually like mine without the bones since science has told me that the dropping of heavy objects in the soup tends to cause splashes.  Ten (10) minutes after the deliveries of salsa/chips and two (2) large horchata on our table, hubby's chilaquiles arrived.  Chilaquiles are versatile and can be made with different kinds of meat or without meat.  Who doesn't like crunchy salsa chips mingled with fresh veggies, avocados, eggs and beans?  The young lady friendly informed me that the menudo was coming soon, while preparing the condiments (fresh-chopped white onion, poblano peppers, and oregano).  Wow, that menudo (dreaming about lovely tripes dancing in my mouth...) didn't skimp on the amount of tripes.  Every single scoop until the last bite was tripe-ful!  The tripe tasted tender and was easy to chew and swallow.  The broth was also flavorful, and there was no need to boost the acidity by adding lime juice.  The Italian soccer game on TV and lively Mexican folk music kept us busy.  After some intellectual conversations about soccer between hubby and I, our food was steadily transported to our stomaches.  The price points were also reasonable.  Our total with two (2) grande horchata, huevo chilaquiles, and menudo came to under $23 before tip.  I wish that heavenly menudo was offered everyday of the week.  Now you should know Rosa J.'s best companion on the weekend is menudo.  We will be back, as least I will certainly lure hubby to service more calls in this direction of the city.  I want to try their Mariscos next time when I come in.

9.description: The food was awful the breaded fish was fried hard and burned. The meat from my torta tasted old.

26.description: I LOVE this restaurant! I have been here at least 50,11 times and every time I come here, I leave as full as a fat lady's purse when giving free samples. Everything is fresh, except for the chips on certain days, you can taste the hours have they not been eaten but besides that no complaints. The waitresses with all their makeup and lure are respectful and present great customer service. I recommend this place to anyone with an Mexican food itch to scratch.

25.description: Ordered a chicken flauta dinner and a steak taco.  Steak taco was tasty best i've had on the southside so far. Flautas were big but a bit dry. So filling.. I was only able to eat the taco and a bite of the flauta.

12.description: Never expected to find this great mexican at this location, glad we stopped.Chips and salsa, great!Steak taco - best I've ever had!Beans - awesome flavor (made with chorizo)Piña Colada - though it was freezing out made me feel like I was at a resort! YumAl pastor  - flavor missing something too much sauce for our liking, sorry.Horchata pitcher - very good and ice served on the side, so nice to pay for the drink and not the ice! Menudo - BEST EVERService - very attentive*** loved the way they served bowls of chopped onion on the side of salsa, nice touch so some could add and others didn't have too.Extra bonus nice TVs to watch a game.Next time we are in that neighborhood we would go back, but just found out they have two other locations!

21.description: The place to go for authentic Mexican food!!! Their chips and salsa are the best !!! Sometimes I go in just to buy that! Their piña coladas are also my favorite from all that I have had!!! And for the people that partied a little bit too much on the weekend they have great micheladas!!! The neighborhood that it's in the the down side!!!

17.description: What are you waiting for?   Arriving to Cocula's Restaurant has a unique feeling like no other. Tire shops and factory workers surround the restaurant, making it stand out like a "diamond in the rough". Once inside of the gated parking lot the smell of Mexican cuisine hits you urging you to walk faster.    Walking into the restaurant it is a sight to see. Large wooden tables on one end and vibrant colorful tables on the other, traditional Mexican music coming from the juke box, and the smiling faces of everyone inside seemed so unreal. The art pieces hanging off the walls intrigued my eyes as I scanned the large room. The drastic contrast between inside and outside made it take a while to settle in and find a table. Decisions, decisions   Once I made my seating decision, my smiling waitress then approached me with a menu and chips with salsa. The menu is well organized and filled with many authentic Mexican cuisines. Adding pictures of their cooked meals menu does a great job at accommodating non-Spanish speakers. With over fifty reasonably priced items to choose from I was not at all ready to place my order in a timely fashion. All of the different cuisines had me planning my meal for the next time I would eat here. Eventually I was drawn to their Cocula dinner meal, which offered one tamale, taco, and a tostada with a side of rice and beans.More please!   As I glanced around at the wall paintings, my waitress reappeared to fill my drink without me having to call her over, and had a brief conversation with me. Unlike many big restaurants, my waitress was able to focus on my needs as a customer. After a short waiting time my food was ready. My waitress approached my table with my steaming hot meal. I took no time to dig into my delicious meal. The steak was hot and well seasoned to my likings. So much food on one plate was delightful to see especially for only $9.95. Is there room for nine more?   While I enjoyed my meal I couldn't help but notice the large family sitting across from me ordering their food with three small children running around the table.  At one point one of the waitresses even encouraged the young girl to run faster. It was interesting to see this because in most restaurants families are encouraged to keep their children seated, but because this is a family restaurant the behavior was encouraged. Fantástica!   My experience at Cocula's Restaurant was one of the best I have had in a long time. Between family warmth, Mexican culture, tasty food, inexpensive prices, and the warm customer service I am not sure which I enjoy most.  Overall Cocula's Restaurant gets 5 out of 5 stars because they made sure to integrate Mexican culture in the customers dinning experience. If you are looking for a family spot to eat ethnic Mexican cuisine with the Mexican culture surrounding you, this is surely the place to go.

10.description: I read all the rave reviews. And one night my boyfriend and I decided we were going to stop by and grab a bite to eat. To not make this dreadful long story very short, this was our most tasteless  restaurant experience ever. The cleanliness sucked and the food sucked even more very bland tasteless food! I'm going to post some pics which is a perfect example of how looks can be very deceiving..... Save your money!!!

5.description: I thoroughly enjoyed my meal today. The flavor was outstanding. The only issue that I had was that our waitress rarely checked on us and took a little long to bring the bill and to-go containers. But I will undoubtedly be back.  Hopefully soon.I had to come back and update my review. My leftovers were just as delicious as the day I originally ordered. And I really got to see how fresh the ingredients were. I want another burrito right now.
