3.description: Been her a couple times and it's ok. The staff is always friendly except for the chunkier older gentleman that is behind the counter. The drinks are always amazing though. But not the best Mexican food.

35.description: Changing my review since my wife and I will not eat here anymore.  We were regulars there over the last two years but one waitress in particular kept getting the orders wrong and always blamed us for it.  The last straw was when she claimed I ordered a chicken burrito when I had said steak.  I had always ordered a steak burrito with a coffee so was rather confused.  My wife also heard me say steak.  She refused to return the food so i tried to eat it but was too angry to take more than a coupla bites.  The same waitress had botched a coconut shake order with chocolate on the previous visit but we figured it was a language issue.  Plus the shake turned out to be good.  Not so much the chicken burrito.  We don't like being called or treated as liars so will pick another out of the gazillion Mexican restaurants in Chicago.

19.description: Some of the BEST Mexican food I've ever had in my entire life. Coming from a hispanic family myself, I feel that's saying a lot. I found this place because it was mentioned in another review by another Yelper. I saw the pictures and was convinced to give it a go. The first time I came here, I got the burrito suiza with the rice and beans, chicken nacho appetizer, fonduta (cheese dip) appetizer, and my boyfriend got an asada (steak) burrito. Everything was so damn good. We were so full we damn near needed a wheelchair to get out of the place. We still had enough leftovers for another entire meal. Since then, we've been back 2-3 more times, and it's been fairly consistent. Definitely a go-to place for some of the best mexican food on the south side of Chicago.ps) I also had the enchiladas...they were decent but not all that. The chorizo fonduta is to die for!GO! Your mouth will thank you.

45.description: My friend Mike + I's "Burrito Sunday," search continued, last week, as we drove out to Chicago's southern lakefront towards South Shore's S. Commercial strip. There were few options up the strip, granted it was a Sunday evening. We passed Cocula + it's Chile's exterior a few times but were eventually won over by it's parking lot option + overall slim pickens elsewhere. First couple of thoughts upon entering Cocula: "Did this used to be a Wendy's?" + "It's packed!". A mix of good/bad signs, depending how you look at it. We found a booth + were soon handed our menus (their menus resemble that of a Mexican Denny's) + a basket of chips/salsa. The chips were a lot like Tostidos + the salsa was a standard red w/ a lot of cilantro thrown in perhaps to cover up the store bought flavor. I gave Cocula an extra star due to the fact that they not only had horchata but they had it by the PITCHER. I was sold! Sure, it wasn't the best horchata I've had but the pitcher option was a big selling point in my starved state. While we waited for our order, I noticed a girl no older than 9 eat an entire vat dressed in a goblet of dark red shrimp cocktail. She managed to pick out the tempting slices of avocado + left them to the side. I then looked behind Mike to see the couple seated behind us who I'm assuming had ordered a pitcher of Bloody Mary but it resembled Heinz 57, more so. I had ordered my usual veggie burrito w/ avocado (which they forgot). It arrived with a side of pasty beans + rice, which had three kernals of corn + two green peas. I was hungry so overlooked the redundancy of the rice/bean mix. The burrito was ok, no flavors really jumped out at me. Mike had ordered a steak burrito + was pleased with it's medium/well-done texture. I could have gone with more spice, something more memorable but my burrito definitely left me feeling full + I had to pass on the last cupful of horchata left in the pitcher. All that said, the staff was rather nice + the price was resonable. I'm sort of bored with writing this review ...Sort of like my Cocula experience.

33.description: This place has great authentic Mexican food. The burritos, tortas, enchiladas and tampiquenas are great. Service is average and the drinks are very tasty and affordable. Plenty of seating and parking is also available. This place knocks out the competition in most of Chicago.

43.description: Named after the city of Cocula, Jalisco, Mexico. Stands out from its surroundings because it's big, new-looking, and has its own large parking lot. Open until 3 AM, if you are on the far South Side in the dead of night, here is a good place to go.Meal starts out with a lot of complimentary tortilla chips, salsa, and escabeche vegetables. All of these were OK but not outstanding. Also included slices of fresh lime, which is somewhat uncommon. Iced tea arrived in a huge glass goblet and also had a slice of lime. Was impressed by that but disappointed to find that it is pre-sweetened instant tea, not real brewed. Very slick menu, with breakfast, lunch, and dinner selections lavishly illustrated with color photos. This aspect made me feel as if in a Mexican version of "Denny's" or something like that, I found out later the reason is that it's one of several "Cocula" restaurants in a chain.Ordered the chiles rellenos. With corn tortillas, actually received flour tortillas. Oh well, I like flour tortillas also, and it's 2:30 AM, and.. I'm hungry... Quantity is above average, getting really a lot of food and enough to take out the leftovers for another small meal at home. The salad accompanying the meal was above average and includes avocado, red cabbage, onion, and dressing. Other than that, I felt everything is good but not outstanding. The building is a work-in-progress at this time: because it's new, they haven't painted most of the walls yet, there is no ceiling installed yet so you see the ventilation ducts and wiring above. Will be nicer when they finish it and I would predict this to become a popular hang-out for the neighborhood. Prices a little bit above average but still inexpensive. The proprietor and waitress were very kind. This place may have the effect of competing with more unique / idiosyncratic taquerias and small restaurants in the area. But overall have to see it as a good thing.

2.description: Overall i enjoyed my food! They forgot my steak and I cancelled it and she bought it out late anyway and charged me! I will go again cause I haven't been here since'91 i want to try 7 seafood soup!

18.description: Hands down, the best tacos on the south side of Chicago, or East side. You might not like the location, but you'll be amazed by the food. Drinks are very good too.....didn't expect it but, they have tv's so you could watch the bears game while you enjoy their masterful, authentic as all hell, yummyfied tacos.... Also, you have to try the parillada for two...

41.description: great for a quick mexican fix. The drinks could be better, but the food is delicious. The latin music coming from the juke box ties it all together and the staff has great table manners, in addition it was also recently renovated and expanded.

4.description: If you want some Mexican food, this is the place to go. It is a clean establishment. The waiters are very nice and helpful. It's also inexpensive. You will enjoy your food.

6.description: I ordered a ground beef taco dinner to go.  Nothing about it was authentic to me.  The taco shells fell apart, the meat texture  was not ground beef.  The beans were just beans with some cheese.  And my napkins had spots on then.  I had been here before for a late night meal but in the light of day ... Not so sure I like it as much.

22.description: Fantastic Authentic Mexican Food! Really good horchataoh yeah Tortas are terrific!! ! I changed jobs, and it never stopped being one of my favorite lunch spots!

15.description: Tasty and affordable Mexican food with spice level ranging from just enough to hoo-boy! Try the soups. I had ENCHILADAS MEXICANAS because I had a craving for mole sauce. Scarfed 'em down without stopping for breath. Also, their guacamole is the best I have ever had anywhere. The large keeps four-plus people happy while the entrees are prepared.

20.description: I tried the "camarones a la plancha" they where very good I had not tried some shrimp that good. I would definetly recommend this restaurant and the service is great.

36.description: One of my favorite places to eat.  Starting with the chips and salsa.  GREAT!  Move on to the steak fajitas or chicken flauta dinner.  FANTASTIC!  Then wash it down with the best ever horchata.  YUMMM!You can't go wrong here.  The food is very impressive.  I love it.  Thanks.

14.description: Tacos were good.  But my order was wrong and the waitress didnt check on us once. The place could be cleaner too.

3.description: : I went tonight to get a late snack and there was a gentleman in front of  us walking. He was walking because it was late and only the drive thru was open. He made his order and they told him he could not order because he did not have a car. So he asked me if I could order for him and he gave me his money. So I did or at least I tried to at fist I told him I wanted to make two separate orders and he said that McDonald's does not do separate orders over the drive thru . The guy ( the manger) said I could not order for the other persons order. This McDonald's manager was a total asshole. I don't know if he didn't want to take his order because he didn't have a car or if it was because he was a young African American male. I do know the mangers name is Hugo. I thought McDonalds is a business and there primary objective is to make money and to keep the customer happy.

1.description: This is just about the crappiest McDonald's you could go to.. I'm really not sure how it's still in business. It's ghetto and dirty and for some reason the chick in drive thru never gets your order right! No ice means no ice. Fresh fries does not equal uncooked fries. This will be my last time visiting this place and I'm sure the only reason it's still in business is because ppl in this location unfortunately cannot eat or have access to anything better.

2.description: HORRIBLE. The worst McDonald's. Their fries are burnt, they never have anything, and the food is just nasty!!! Don't go trust me. I've lived around here for 15 years and at first it was okay but in the last 7 years they've become crappy.

0.description: It's a McDonalds. There's a drive thru. There's an indoor playground. Most of the patrons were yelling on their phones. The wifi was down and apparently had been broken for awhile.My hot chocolate from the McCafe was really good.

58.description: i am crazy about rotofugi, the adorable, beautiful toys, and the awesome people who work there. to be more specific, these are the kind of people who will sit around making the dolls dance with each other when it gets slow. if you have a problem with that, you hate happiness. the gallery is even more amazing than the toy store itself. openings are always warm and unintimidating with the requisite free snacks, wine, etc. i'm bad at making aesthetic generalizations, but all the art i've seen here has been incredible/excited me more than many other local galleries. many of the artists definitely have a playful quality to their work/explicitly "play" with images one might typically categorize as adorable/innocent. beyond that, the only thing the artists seem to have in common is that they all rule.

56.description: There is a gallery in the back, but the entire store is a gallery in itself. Regulars will quickly develop love/hate relationships with the blind boxes. The concept of leaving the purchase up to chance is like that of toy vending machines (wiki gashapon for more info). Sure, it's frustrating not to get the figure that you want, but the joy of (finally) getting "the one" makes it worth the trouble, just like the lottery (oh vices). And, of course, the blind boxes are an excuse to make more purchases ;DThe prices are just right; buying one or two on a visit won't seem a splurge, but the urge to collect all of them will burn a bigger hole in your wallet over time. The great service does not help my pocketbook ;P

29.description: This is a very cool shop for unique toys, apparel, accessories, and art.  I love coming in here and browsing through all of the products.  Once my brothers get to an age where they don't break everything, I'll buy them some stuff from this place.  The prices are a little high but I doubt you'll see stuff like this in any other store in Chicago.  It is worth an excursion inside!

42.description: I've been to a lot of awesome toy stores in my day, but I keep coming back to you, Rotofugi! And your new location and store-size just takes it to the next level. Truth be told, when I'm across the country for work, I still by all my designer toys from you guys. Why? Because that's just the love I got for you.Your prices are great, and you aren't restricted to one genre of art toys and accessories. You got a little bit of everything, and boy does it work for me.Never go out of business, yeah?HEART!

23.description: I cannot say enough wonderful things about this place!  I stop in fairly regularly to add to my vinyl toy collection and am still wowed every time.  They have a great variety of toys, posters, books, magazine and so much more.  I love the "Roto-O-Rama" (one of those classic Mold-O-Rama machines) in the back there you can make your own plastic toy.  I have met one of the owners and she was extremely nice and friendly, as are the rest of the staff.  This place is a must for any vinyl toy or lowbrow art lover!

47.description: I mean... what's not to love?  I recently dropped some serious coin at Rotofugi and didn't think twice about it.  This place AWESOME.

8.description: Love coming here, faboulous designer toys and artwork! I can't leave without at least buying one dunny!

31.description: This place is AMAZING! My boyfriend, family, and I went here while visiting relatives who live outside Chicago (I live in Anaheim, CA). We looked up reviews here and once we saw pictures we absolutely had to make a trip since my boyfriend and I are vinyl-addicts and my younger sister loves Tokidoki.The inside of the store is awesome- very spacious and there's tons of vinyl everywhere. Even my parents who don't "get" the whole vinyl toy thing had fun looking around. There's really something for everyone! My boyfriend and I bought tons of Labbit blindboxes, stickers, and Unicorno blindboxes, but in hindsight I wish I had bought more stuff. I think I was just a little overwhelmed, the selection is MUCH larger than the Kidrobot we have in Los Angeles, and Rotofugi carries tons more brands.Coming here was completely worth the trip, the only downside is I wish there was one over here in California! Good thing they have a great online store.

34.description: one star off for high prices...4 stars for a very entertaining store :)i luv all the knick knacks and toys and books and paintings...very ecclectic...very fun...artfully arranged and easy to browsethink of it as urban outfitters on crack...minus the clothing and housewares

16.description: Bottom line:  While most of the vinyl toys are meant for collectors, children with discerning tastes will be well served here in the gift department with reasonably priced blind boxes, unusual plushies (check out the Pecanpals) and tees. $5 to $40 range.Inspiring collection of the best designer toys with something in every price range ($5 to several hundred).  Mostly new vinyl, maybe a tiny selection of vintage Japanese.  Lots of one of kind pieces and big names here.  More Secret Base than I've ever seen in one place in person.  If you have understood this review so far...you are drooling perhaps.If you are into graphic design or toys at all, you really must go._________________________________________________________I want to give you six stars, Rotofugi.  The best big kid toy store I've been to in the US.  Designer vinyl toys to make you cry.  Bigger, badder and more dangerous now that they've consolidated all their holdings into one giant, light filled space.The gallery is beautiful, huge.  It's as big as La Luz de Jesus in LA!  I had the pleasure of attending the opening of Ralph Cosentino and Martin Tsu (Ruby Gloom fame) during this sojourn to Chi-Town.  My heart was happy, my wallet was lighter and my walls now have 3 Cosentino prints! (I'm braggggging!)Thank you to the owners and staff for being so kind, so approachable. No hipper than thou at Rotofugi, thanks!   Thank you for shipping my prints happily, explaining things to me and...even giving me great tips on where to eat in town!

13.description: Honestly CANNOT say enough good things about Rotofugi. I haven't been to the shop, but their online customer service is seriously top-notch. Every time I email them with questions, they're not only friendly but EXTREMELY helpful and crazy fast with replies (they always reply within a few hours which is something i've never experienced from any other businesses). They answer everything in detail and truly put an effort to be helpful whether or not they have the product in stock. I've always been super impressed by their customer service. Other designer toy stores need to learn from them *cough*3Dretro*cough* (warning- don't buy from them, i''ve experienced the worst non-existent customer service from them).Roto's prices are always fair and reasonable and they dont jack up prices for pieces are harder to find elsewhere. Flat rate shipping is cheaper than most toy stores and they even use PRIORITY 2 DAYS shipping!! From what I've experienced, not many stores are willing to use priority 2 days...I usually always have to wait at least a week for orders. I received my package and it was very carefully packed, even filled with packing peanuts even though my toys weren't that fragile. And here's the thing that blew my mind- they wrapped every boxed toy individually in paper (taped up and everything like a present) so it was pretty freakin awesome being able to unwrap every item as if I were unwrapping presents!!!! (it was like christmas  in January! and I don't even get to unwrap presents on xmas at this age...)If possible I would've given roto 10 stars. Will definitely be buying all my toys here from now on :) so worth it! Hope they stay in the toy scene/business for a loong looooong time!

11.description: Fun, clever, and imaginative. Rotofugi is a brilliant mix of collectible, modern toys and art. The shop is in the ground floor of a beautiful vintage building, they have high ceilings and lots of windows which makes Rotofugi just a great space to be in.The toys are awesome and there is something for everybody, no matter what their age or interests. The art in the gallery area changes regularly and is always great to check out. This is a great place to bring out-of-towners, go gift shopping, or spend part of an afternoon just looking at all the cool stuff.Very glad to see you are doing well Rotofugi, I can't wait to shop again!

39.description: Going to this store was a new experience for me. Never been to a place like this before, and it took me a while to take in all this place has to offer. My brother, being a huge fan of kid robot, brought me here while we were on a mission to find him a traveling "gnome". We eventually picked out a plush labbit. I also purchased a charger for my android, which resembles the green Android robot, whose name is Andru. I digress.This store is brightly lit, well-organized and very clean. All the products are arranged very neatly on shelves, so neatly I feared touching any of them because it will ruin their arrangement, sort of, not really. I really enjoyed this place because it made me feel like a kid again, playing with toys and laughing at how entertaining they can be. Oh, the many things I miss about being a child.This was a fun adventure I embarked on with my brother and I loved it all. Kudos.

37.description: We had no intention of going to this store....We wanted to grab a drink at Delilah's and they weren't quite open yet. So we decided to stop in to this store to kill like 15 minutes. Little did we know, we would end up spending almost an hour...in sheer amazement. They have so much cool stuff! Trinkets galore. A ton of cutesy erasers (my friend Mel grabbed the macaron ones). Little zipper pulls and figurines. A gun note pad! Buttons! ORIGAMI POSTCARDS!I really didn't think there was gonna be anything I'd want, but I actually found a print by Shannon Bonatakis that I fell in love with. I couldn't leave without it. I wasn't looking for art, I almost never buy art. I just couldn't help myself. Had to have it. They also have a couple of artists on display and there was a dinosaur piece up that I reallllly liked (just because I love dinos) but it was like $250 and I'm not rich. So glad Delilah's wasn't open yet, would have missed a really cool spot. I would go back just to look at the art work.

0.description: Rotofugi is a toy store for grown-ups!  Kids are going to like it too.  I don't know anything about collectibles or much of the nerdy stuff that's here, but I did buy an adorable plastic/vinyl figurine of Peanuts' notorious bossy gal, Lucy Van Pelt.  I also picked up X-Files' Mulder & Scully figurines for my friend.  From Disney princesses to aliens, these figurines are only $11 each and can perk up a cubicle or fancy pants office.T-shirts, tote bags, notepads, pens, and toys, toys, toys!  This is a spacious spot that also includes lots of art on the walls and a separate space that hosts a small art gallery.  Check it out - I dare you to not spend a dime here!  If not for yourself, you'll find something for someone else.

38.description: a little bit toy store a little bit art gallery and LOADS of designer FUN!*remember* munny . kid robot . and other random japanese toys . art . books?this place has it all~ just go and *explore*~*~a definite stop for a blast into the past . a picker upper . and to see sup in the artS ;p

51.description: can't wait to visit this store when i hit up chicago! My rating is based on their online business. Fast Shipping and cool free stickers added to  my order. Marshalls are the best. We need a Rotofugi in Boston

27.description: I have recently been to Rotofugi Designer Toy Store & Gallery and I have to admit that I was impressed by the wide array of exclusive toys, accessories and arts that it offers. It was a pleasure for me to take a look at all the products and to buy several fascinating toys for my kids. I have to say that the toys are excellent for teenagers who are fond of art. And you can even take them with you when going to this store because there is an astonishing gallery situated in the back of the store that displays an amalgam of national and local artwork. The staff is really polite, helpful and kind and it never forces you to buy something. All the goods are well-arranged on the shelves, so it is impossible not to find what you are looking for. This place has something to offer to everyone, so don't hesitate to go there!

32.description: This gallery is the sh_t.Go if you like cool things.Do not go if you hate your life.Just kidding, but seriously - Rotofugi is amazing and every city should have a comparable gallery.  Space + toys + art selection + friendly albeit sort of hipster snooty staff. (Quit hitting on my Filipino girlfriend!) ;)Keep being awesome RotoF.

54.description: this place makes my head explode i love it so much. tables and shelves of the most creative objects ever. blind boxes GALORE. t-shirts. plush. friendly people behind the counter and art hanging in an adjacent gallery makes for a perfect moment. every time. bring your imagination and your checkbook!

48.description: I am an avid designer toy collector and this place is great. It's in a really good area of town, too. I think this location is a step-up from their previous location, space-wise. It holds more products and has more space for the art gallery. They have a pretty good inventory of toys, magazines, and other random stuff. The workers are always super friendly, and sometimes I'll see the owners with their dog (which I think is pretty awesome!) I definitely recommend this place for anyone, toy collector or not.

44.description: Rotofugi   - If you love vinyl collectibles, blind boxes, unique gifts this is the place to shop.  I usually go here a couple of times a year.  I always find some little vinyl figure that I must have and I'm addicted to those blind boxes.  They have a large collection of ugly dolls, books, original artwork and limited edition pieces.  It's a fun, funky little shop with a wide range of prices that start at just a couple of bucks.

24.description: This has to be one of the best places to works everyone is always happy helpful and Kirby the owner is always super nice. It is a designer toy store with awesome unique doo dads to show off and impress your friends. They have things only your imagination should have, for sale. Cool artwork, stickers, toys on every wall and shelf. It's very easy to get in a lot of trouble with a credit card here.

7.description: Rotofugi is one of the most creative and crazy places I've ever been in my life!It's a veritable playground for anybody who loves quirky characters, funky art, and thinking outside the box. Kids and adults alike will go nuts for everything they have to offer. Rotofugi is a store filled with things I never knew I wanted but once I see them I feel I need! They've got an extensive merchandise offering in-store as well as online, and for the true art lovers there's a gallery in back showcasing artists and their talent.Go on a visit to Rotofugi, and experience what it's like to be a kid again (and a kid with way more spending money, at that!)!

49.description: About three weeks ago I was sitting in the front window at Delilah's having a beer and looking outside, into Roto's gallery window.When from inside the gallery this little mutt looking dog slowly waddles up to their windowstops in the windowlooks across the street at melifts its legand pees on their radiator.Mutt gives me a wink, turns around, and walks back into the gallery.Stars for having a kick-ass dog wandering around after hours.Cool products for sale, too.

40.description: I absolutely adore this designer toy shop!  I've been a fan of Shawnimals and Ugly Dolls for a few years now and finally got a chance to stop by this store.  The selection is awesome - ranging from cute to funky toys.  They would definitely be great gifts for people looking for something unique.  There aren't any cookie cutter things in this shop.  Also, the gallery in the back looked super awesome - I will definitely check that out since I got there pretty late Saturday and didn't have that much time to browse.Great toys at great prices.  Will definitely be back when in the area again.

53.description: Rotofugi was one of the main reasons for visiting Chicago and this store did not disappoint. The store is large, open and any toy collector's dream. We shopped around with baskets and filled each of ours up with blind boxes from various designers, some bigger vinyl characters and got some t-shirts. The two guys behind the counter were super nice and told us to check out the gallery when we have time. The gallery is simple but impressive as well. Great store, great employees and they carry an amazing variety of toys.

46.description: Hold onto your hearts because they're about to explode with cuteness.The storefront lined with adorable toy models might draw you in.  The stuffed animals, or stuffed personified food, might make you squeal with delight.  The sets of tiny sushi that are smaller than your fingers might make you giggle.  The funny stickers might make you want to buy them all.  I'm just saying these are things that might happen to you when you visit Rotofugi.

1.description: I love all things nerdy! They have all sorts for all ages..cute baby items and souvenirs if you like..The art canvas of the wall was beautiful! I love the mix of colors and I'm sure there was a reason there was a bear on all the canvas but I'm not sure why. Other animals would've been as much appreciated..food for thought.Overall: I got a positive energy being there! That's one way to be recreational!

55.description: One of the best and most fun stores ever. I was concerned about the move from Chicago/Damen to Racine/Lincoln/Diversey, unwilling to give up brunch at someplace like Jam or Cleo's and then Roto, but it's a six-of-one thing, as the new location offers its own nearby treasures, such as the Powell's used bookstore on Lincoln about a block north of the Roto store. Plus, the staff is absolutely the very best, and the prices are very reasonable - just one of my favorite places anywhere. The new gallery space is awesome, too. And the gallery shows have for the most part been excellent. My only gripe is nominal: I'd like to see shows with more larger-sized pieces, sometimes too small seems too small and too precious to me, but I totally get smaller, especially when smaller means more saleable/affordable, so kudos to Roto's owners for keeping art accessible and affordable in that sense.

9.description: This is probably one of the best stops that we've made while we are visiting Chicago!!! There are so many cool & fun toys in the store, it made us so happy :D I like that you can purchase the toys on their website and the shipping is only $5 if you spend less than $100 (it's free if you spend $100). Highly recommend to check out this place if you're a toy nerd!

26.description: This place was made for my girlfriend and I. We both adore blind boxes and designer toys, and Rotofugi is the place to get them! Best place outside of Japan to find stuff like this.

25.description: Everyone that works at Rotofugi is extremely nice.  They have everything!!! If you are looking for Muni or Kidrobot toys they have them... the only problem with this store is you will want to buy everything there.

12.description: Whenever I'm in a bad mood, I head to Rotofugi.They have a million bazillion cute and fun things, as well as one of those plastic mold toy makers (the roto-matic). There's nothing quite like the smell of just-molded warm plastic.An excellent place for gifts as well! I hit them up pretty much every holiday.

59.description: A toy store for big kids? Sign me up. It might not be the place that you take your 5 year old to buy a Barbie/GI Joe/whatever kids play with these days, but its perfect for me. I always have a great experience shopping here and some days its fun even just to window shop because there is always something new. I love the huge new location and the staff is always cool. I wish the t-shirts didn't cost so much but hey, what are you going to do? I still love the place and I will be back again, and again, and again....

21.description: This place is heaven on earth. Remarkable selection of rare and unique toys, including my fave Frank Kozik. Picked up 2 pretty cool prints too, which I didn't know they carried. The managers (or owners, not sure) were very friendly and helpful and made me feel like less of a nyerd than I normally do. Even if you don't take yourself to be into these sorts of collectibles, stop in, and you might be surprised.

17.description: How lovely, great place to stop in and take a look. They have everything fun under the sun! Not an exaggeration. Reminds me of my childhood when I would look into the department stores with my Mom and just wish for all the Barbie's and the toys I could possibly handle.Don't go here with kids though, you won't come out with a penny to your name!

10.description: My son is really into some of the brands of toys sold here so we took a special trip. The layout is done so you can appreciate each of the items. It's very organized and artistically pleasing. The selection of Pop figures was a little lacking so if you are looking for a specific item, I would call first. But many cute things from Japanese erasers  and stickers to vinyl figures. The salesperson was very helpful and welcoming.

5.description: I used to go here all the time when it was in UV, and its my first time I have been since they moved.  The visit came as a request of my nephew, who I used to spoil with the Kid Robot Dunny toys, and he asked if we could go. I have totally forgotten about Rotofugi somehow, and I"m so glad we went today.  What an amazing space!  Huge, open and what an amazing selection!  Wonderful art gallery too!  I loved it!  I'm actually going back tomorrow because I'm regretting a couple purchases I didn't make.Keep up the awesome work Rotofugi, you are one of a kind!

3.description: These aren't the toys we were looking for. Don't get me wrong, there's nothing wrong with the place..just not our cup of tea.  My 7yr old son spotted a couple interesting things but the majority of the stuff in here is more suited for teens to adults.  I added a star for their attached art gallery, which had some cool stuff. They had a pretty slick Star Wars AT-AT that we really liked.

35.description: Every time we go to Chicago, we HAVE to visit this vinyl toy store.  They have wonderful, eclectic, humorous and, sometimes, very hard to find goodies! The staff is always helpful, pleasant and NEVER pushy.  Their tee shirts are always new and different, and we can always find a few kid friendly toys to bring home to our son.The art gallery in the rear of the store is worth an extra 15 minutes of exploration as well.  One never knows who's art is going to be on display, maybe a local who has never shown, or maybe it's Mister Frank Kozik signing Labbits....yep....

19.description: A really fun toy store!  I have never seen many of the items that were available here.  The art and figurines are unique and there is so much to look at!

28.description: Since moving to the Lincoln Ave space, it's even easy to shop during gallery openings, as there's sooo much space.The Rotomatic is working!

45.description: I finally had the opportunity to stop in here.  This place is an adult toy store and I really liked it.  This place is perfect to find things to put on your desk at work.  Everyone has the mug..."World's Greatest Boss" but if you shop here you can get a Marsh mellow puking!!!  Now that is a perfect addition to any desk. (I know it sounds bad but it is done really tastefully...pun intended)It was a bunch of fun to walk around and check out the different toys.  I found a Hugh Heffner doll too.  I wonder if Hef knows...he would love it.  Attention marketing department...mail one to the Playboy Mansion.I also loved that one of the dolls had a brick mobile phone.  I had to try and explain to my little one that cell phones were that big.  Sad part is that the guy behind the counter also was learning from my story too.  Am I really that old?Great use of space...there is also an art gallery here too.  I love there new space...I remember when they were crammed in on Chicago Ave.So if your looking for some cool and unique toys for your desk, then this is the place!!!

33.description: This is the perfect store for a grown up art kid who can still tap his inner child.The new(er) digs are great and allow you to more room to browse and concentrate on the merchandise, which features a little bit of everything. I really liked the collector t shirts with the local flare. I will warn you, I don't think this is the best place for kids. Teens maybe, little kids no.If by chance the toys aren't enough, there is a gallery in the back of the store featuring a mix of local and national artwork that you can view and sometimes buy.The store offers easy access, just about seven blocks west of the brown line. If you get the chance, you should stop by and check it out.

43.description: This place makes me feel like I'm 10 years old again, seriously. It's only downfall for me is... I'm more likely to spend more money than I should on cute vinyl trinkets for my desk. Nerds/graphic designers, beware. This is a place that carries Kid Robot, Tokidoki, and all those other fun exclusive toy brands.I will say it's fun to go there to check out what they have and admire their displays. Plus they have a gallery in back which is cool for us artsy folk to check out. My interaction with the staff has been minimal, but they've always been super friendly and seem like people I'd hang out with.

2.description: I have never liked dolls, still don't. But I wouldn't say no to one of the pop culture figurines from Rotofugi.  I'm still waiting to hear if they will get more of the Mia Wallace figurines for my desk, but even if that doesn't come to fruition, I'm sure I'll be happy with some other pop culture doll. This store is full, FULL, of interesting designer toys, paper products, Chicago-themed home decor/gifts, pens/pencils, art projects and a small rack of funky t-shirts.  One section of the store is a small art gallery which is worth checking out too. I purchased a super cute pizza slice t-shirt for my son and a zip pouch made from recycled material for me. This is a store for someone who loves attention to detail and pop culture. Clean, sleek...you could probably find something new each time your walk around the store.

18.description: Full of win!!! Looking for something funky, imported Japanese toys, t shirts, artwork... the list goes on and on. This is my go-to shop for unique fun things for my husband or teenage son. We have bought several pieces of original artwork from them over the years as well as many blind-box keychains and toys. There is something here for every budget and all ages. The staff and extremely knowledgeable and passionate about their store and their products and honestly, it is just always super FUN to visit!

41.description: One of my favorite places to shop. They stay open for you, they are so nice, and the stuff they have is so awesome!

52.description: I wanted to buy some cool toys and the toys you can buy here are prohibitively expensive. This appears to be a store run by wealthy art-school kids.  I was so sad. If you are a wealthy art school kid you will LOVE it though, it does have a lot of arty toys and art on display.  Be sure to bring a full wallet, though.

50.description: A toy store for the big kids!It is definitely a "designer" toy store. Even though everything looks like it is geared towards young children, it is really more for the adult collector who likes to look and admire rather than play.Their store is very cool. It's located at the corner of two streets and is shaped like a triangle. You walk in and there are display cases everywhere. Stuff animals, blind boxes, and huge statues cover the room. I liked the layout, but at the same time, the place seemed pretty empty. They may need to add a little more inventory to so it looks more inviting, but if they are going for a gallery look, then they are right on the money.I did have a chance to talk to the owners (or a couple who worked there) and they seemed pretty stuck up when I asked about the difference between their store and the Kidrobot store in SF. Looks like they are very protective of their store. This store is way bigger than the Kidrobot store in SF and has the same items and more. I bought the Street Fighter and Futurama blind boxes. The prices were reasonable. Less than ten bucks for both. I can see the appeal of the blind box. You hate it, yet love it at the same time. The anticipation and excitement gets you. Once you open the box, you will either be extremely happy or disappointed. It's all in fun. They have an online store so if you don't want to make the trek out to the actual store (which is pretty far from downtown Chicago btw), you can easily access them from the convenience of your own computer.

4.description: If you love cute little things, you will love this place.  They have so many figurines that it will blow your mind.  You will want to buy everything there until you get the figurine of your liking.  They sell blind boxes.  They also have an art gallery section and feature different artist all the time.  Caution: this is not a place for small children who like to put things in their mouth, it may result in a choking hazard.

6.description: I'd been meaning to go to Rotofugi for a long time, even if just to see what they had to offer beyond rare toys that I'd never buy. I wasn't disappointed. The nicest thing about this place is that they have a huge amount of merchandise that's unique (at least in Chicago) and very affordable. I was looking for a few small gifts--the kind of thing one could send in the mail without much hassle. If anything, I had so many options that it was a bit overwhelming. That's not a bad thing.While I'm not necessarily the target audience, it's a great store for browsing through custom-made stuffed animals, weird toys, and a wide variety of other items, whether they be cute or a little warped. The store's in a beautiful space with tons of natural light, the staff is very friendly and helpful, and it's certainly a place that might easily contain the exact thing you never knew you wanted but now can't imagine exiting Rotofugi without adding it to your collection.

22.description: How lovely, great place to stop in and take a look. They have everything fun under the sun! Not an exaggeration. Reminds me of my childhood when I would look into the department stores with my Mom and just wish for all the Barbie's and the toys I could possibly handle.Don't go here with kids though, you won't come out with a penny to your name!

15.description: Vinyl collector or not you'll find something every time. I have been shopping here for years and their inventory is PHENOMENAL. Love this store, the owners and staff are the best and I will forever come again and again and again to shop!!!!!

57.description: Bottom line:  While most of the vinyl toys are meant for collectors, children with discerning tastes will be well served here in the gift department with reasonably priced blind boxes, unusual plushies (check out the Pecanpals) and tees. $5 to $40 range.Inspiring collection of the best designer toys with something in every price range ($5 to several hundred).  Mostly new vinyl, maybe a tiny selection of vintage Japanese.  Lots of one of kind pieces and big names here.  More Secret Base than I've ever seen in one place in person.  If you have understood this review so far...you are drooling perhaps.If you are into graphic design or toys at all, you really must go._________________________________________________________I want to give you six stars, Rotofugi.  The best big kid toy store I've been to in the US.  Designer vinyl toys to make you cry.  Bigger, badder and more dangerous now that they've consolidated all their holdings into one giant, light filled space.The gallery is beautiful, huge.  It's as big as La Luz de Jesus in LA!  I had the pleasure of attending the opening of Ralph Cosentino and Martin Tsu (Ruby Gloom fame) during this sojourn to Chi-Town.  My heart was happy, my wallet was lighter and my walls now have 3 Cosentino prints! (I'm braggggging!)Thank you to the owners and staff for being so kind, so approachable. No hipper than thou at Rotofugi, thanks!   Thank you for shipping my prints happily, explaining things to me and...even giving me great tips on where to eat in town!

20.description: Love coming here, faboulous designer toys and artwork! I can't leave without at least buying one dunny!

36.description: It's a motherload of randomness in here.  I've visited a few times now, and the art on display is always creative, often graphic-art-cartoonish, and occasionally disturbing.  The toys they have shelved run the gamut of cute to crazy: zombies, breakdancers, Simpsons figures, samurais. You'll easily spend at least 20 minutes checking everything out and it's tough avoiding an impulse buy.  It's a good spot to buy a gift for a tchotchke collector.

14.description: I finally had the opportunity to stop in here.  This place is an adult toy store and I really liked it.  This place is perfect to find things to put on your desk at work.  Everyone has the mug..."World's Greatest Boss" but if you shop here you can get a Marsh mellow puking!!!  Now that is a perfect addition to any desk. (I know it sounds bad but it is done really tastefully...pun intended)It was a bunch of fun to walk around and check out the different toys.  I found a Hugh Heffner doll too.  I wonder if Hef knows...he would love it.  Attention marketing department...mail one to the Playboy Mansion.I also loved that one of the dolls had a brick mobile phone.  I had to try and explain to my little one that cell phones were that big.  Sad part is that the guy behind the counter also was learning from my story too.  Am I really that old?Great use of space...there is also an art gallery here too.  I love there new space...I remember when they were crammed in on Chicago Ave.So if your looking for some cool and unique toys for your desk, then this is the place!!!

0.description: This place has the best shrimp cocktail ever!! Love this place. They have fried fish dinners as well. The prices are reasonable, the guys are really friendly as well. You can home here to pick out a fish from the tank 2 take home 2 cook as well. Everything you need is probably here. Definitely worth noting.

These guys should be TEACHING all the other shop how to give a Cut & Shave!!!! After getting a shave and go two days later without shaving, and you don't have any razor bumps shows they have the skills and training to teach others whom NEEDS to know this!!! CALL before you show to make sure you will get a cut or shave or both.

1.description: This is hands down, THE WORSE fast food place I have ever been. I have been here hundreds of times throughout the years, every since its opening. The management is lazy and untrained. I frequently get passive service at best, and l I'm constantly told about a 15-20 minute wait on basic menu items. I'm ashsmed of myself everytime I go back!

2.description: Ok so the employees are nice. They ALWAYS forget or mess up at least one part of my order and the long lines are getting tiring. This location has been here for years so there's really no excuse at this point.

0.description: This by far is one of the friendliest fast food establishments that I've been to. Maybe it's because I go there so often for coworkers (and myself!), or just because they're so nice, but I've always loved how they treated their customers. Sometimes food takes longer than usual, but I don't mind, as everything seems to be made to order, and is FRESH! yay!!

3.description: The super taco is the best taco in the city. Hand made tortillas made as you order. Not a real big place but excellent.

1.description: This place should be on Chicago's Best it's a hidden gem I stumbled upon it while getting my car fixed across the street you could smell the amazing seasonings throughout the block trust me you will not be disappointed best spot for authentic mexican cuisine simply amazing.

2.description: I've gone here for many, many years. It's right down the block. Don't let the outside fool you. The food is always fresh, hot and delicious! Every now and then they will have tamales so ask. Super taco- the huge shell is made right in front of you, Their Steak Torta is divine!! Their soups are good too. They do Pasole one day of they wee to I believe. Good authentic eating!

0.description: Never imagined this small place would serve such great food.The tacos are literally Mexico Style, tortillas made by hand there on the spot. They taste just like the tacos I have tried in Mexico City.

3.description: When we walked in we were not greeted, there were also 3 people working with about 10 customers in there. We sat and waited and weren't told anything so we asked how long the wait would be. They said 10 minutes ( we had been there 10 min) after 10 (more) minutes went by we left and went to another salon.

1.description: Diamond nails do good job on every,  nails,  toe, eyelashes,  eyebrow,  In here you will be satisfied with the service

2.description: This place is amazing. They do wonderful work and treats you like family.They take the time to get to know you. I love this place I'll never go anywhere else!Thanks Helen!!!!

5.description: I was looking for a conveniently located, clean, and effective nail salon. I researched nail salons in my area and came across Diamond Nails. How could I pass with a name like that?!? Diamonds are a girl's best friend you know!!! I decided to go with a no chip manicure and spa pedicure. Tutu was my technician and I loved her! She will have a regular customer from now on! Thanks Tutu and Diamond Nails!

6.description: I saw this place had good reviews and I checked out their work on instagram.  I was impressed. I got there around 4:30 and didn't walk out until 7:30. After 45 minutes I felt that I might as well wait it out. But I definitely  didn't expect the wait to be that long.  There was only 3 technicians working. They definitely need more people to accommodate all the business they get. They weren't very welcoming at all. I walked in, no one greeted me and when I asked the woman how long the wait would be I had to ask 3 times because she acted like I wasn't even standing there. The woman who did my nails did a good job. I like the shape and color is applied well. But she left all this residue of the acrylic around my nails. Now I have to pick that all off. Needless to say I won't be coming back.

0.description: I love this place!  They do eyebrows amazingly.  I work in the Loop downtown and those places don't measure up to this place at ALL!  I highly recommend this place to anyone who wants their eyebrows to look perfect.I haven't had my nails done here in a long time since I do them myself but when I did come here I liked getting designs because they really out do themselves.  This place always has people getting mani's and pedi's so I'm guessing they still do a great job.

4.description: So I saw these reviews and decided to go for a visit since I couldn't go to my usual nail salon (Celine's Nail Salon is one of THE BEST) when I got here 20 minutes past opening there were only 7 people and 4 nail salon people, not enough. The wait was super long and my nails came out bubbly (WHICH I HATE) way different from the pictures on here. A lot of loud and rude people coming in and when I saw a fight right outside I just can't. Like I'm never coming back. I do not recommend this place AT ALL.

1.description: Sunday morning breakfast.... Delish!!!! Tamales were really good and tasty! And the carnitas weren't bad.... When it comes to food I'm very very picky and not a fan of trying new things, but I can say I was very pleased that I was forced into having this yesterday. I def will be back!

0.description: This place has the best Carnitas its in a grocery store in middle of the block neighborhood. You pick your own meet I always go here on Sunday. They sell Menudo and Tamales as which are the best and usually sold out if you don't get there early.Also their pico De hallo and guacomale is to die for!

3.description: Seriously, this place is a shithole.The grease they fry their food in tastes like it hasn't been changed in seven years and is beyond bland. Their donuts are always stale and really sketchy people go and spend their day there. The only thing I love about this place is that they have this old school 1950's orange juice machine that churns out FRESH, SQUEEZED orange juice every morning. I love subsituting my coffee with a large cup of this juice! Other than that, if you're looking for decent diner food, head to ROMA'S down the street!

1.description: I was rather disappointed by my food experience here.I got the steak skillet and the meat was tough and had no flavor and the American cheese that oozed through the skillet seem to over power the dish.  You could choose between French toast, regular toast or Pancakes.  The pancakes were ok but I have tasted better. It also began to make my stomach feel queasy so I felt like $11.00 went down the drain. My daughter also got the steak skillet and she didn't like it either...:(It looked so good when the waitress sat the food in front of us but basically we had a skillet filled tough and uneatable food.My granddaughter got the 2+2+2 meal which she enjoyed.  She had pancakes(that she didn't finish) that's unusual for her, but she did like the sausage, eggs and potatoes.I think if you dine here you should keep it simple leave the skillets to another restaurant.  Our waitress was very nice and apologized for us not enjoying our food, but we didn't get a discount for our lackluster experience.  All in all I won't be running back here any time soon even if I am back in the area and starving.You only get one chance to make a first impression and for me that didn't happen!You know how I do!!!!Enjoy!

2.description: We went here for lunch today instead of waiting in Firestone for an oil change. But the food was not very tasty and the service was bad. There was something floating in my water and my pancakes had hair in them. Needless to say I will not be back.

5.description: My husband used them for catering of a large sports banquet.  The gentleman he dealt with was Tony and according to my husband he was amazing - very helpful and extremely generous.  The food was awesome - fried chicken, baked chicken, pasta, salads, breads...... ALL tasted incredible and there was nothing remaining.  There were about 200 happy guests.  Tony even threw in some dessert cakes and delivery was free.  Can't comment on the dine in experience but from a catering standpoint they were the best priced, food was hot and fresh, and the customer service was great.  For anyone looking for catering services on a budget I would highly recommend C & G catering

0.description: C&G is the intersection of Black & Latino Southeast Chicago.You're going to be eating next to abuelos y abuelitas y "eses" y homies from 93rd & Essex yelling in their cell phones talking about "Yo, I want my money, son!"And then you'll see folks like me and my dad, "middle-class" folk from the other side of Commercial Avenue, having breakfast after church. And in between all this neighborhood theater, there are pancakes and French Toast, and hot buttered rice and grits and fresh squeezed juice. There are big sandwiches, like you'd make at home, and spaghetti dinners. Is it outstanding food? No. Is it a "shithole?" No. I like C & G because it does pretend to be anything more than it is: a neighborhood diner. A place where all parts of the neighborhood can eat, together, safely, and be on their way. I can live with that.

4.description: I used C and G to Cater an event!! It was the best experience I've had. I will be using them for all of my future events. I recommend C and G for your catering events.

3.description: If this place is anything like the one on 63rd then u definitely give it 2 thumbs up. Delicious family owned restaurant with huge slices of pizza

1.description: I called for delivery, got a small pizza, fries&a pop. Place is literally about 8 mins from my house. I was told 40 mins which turned into 11/2 hrs. Pizza was cold, fries were cold, etc. Nothing like the one on 63rdst. Place sucks. Pizza was nasty, more cheese than ingredients, never again.  I would've gotten pizza Hut had i known this was gonna be crap.  Save your money & go elsewhere.

2.description: I love De Arcos' spinach pizza! For the past year,  I have been coming here to get my pizza fix. Just Yum!

5.description: Love their grilled chicken salad!! My husband always gets the Gyro pizza...good crust. FYI don't order rib tips

6.description: Hooolllyyyyy crap!!Am I really the FIRST to review this place??! Awh, come on! I know it's in the hood but De Arco's slices are EPIC.Biggest slices ANYWHERE, without a doubt. Bigger than Baci's! Cheaper too. And better tasting in my opinion. For five measly dollars you can get a slice of pizza that could feed an entire African village for a day or two, small fry, and a can of pop. They use quality, fresh ingredients and keep the pies toasting in the oven for overall freshness (a lot of times when you go to places where they sell pizza by the slice, if the pie sits for too long, it doesn't taste too good after all and loses its appeal) at ALL times. Sucks that this place is in such a dangerous neighborhood. Use your discretion when going! A lot of CPD frequent during weekday lunch hours, though! If that makes you feel any better!

0.description: De Arcos has the best pizza & pasta ever ! Friendly staff & Very Clean Facilities ! I would highly recommend you come here ! I promise you won't be disappointed !

4.description: I was not impressed with the delivery or the food.....I think they are overpriced and the food was horrible.....I had a gyro that contained more sauce than meat and the pita bread was very hard, I didnt get to taste the fries because they were frigid an hour and 20 minutes after they were cooked and delivered......im glad I was treated to this meal cuz I would have been livid if I fed this to someone....never again unless they reimburse me and give me credit and fire the cook and delivedy driver in that order....

3.description: I have been to Beautiful Sisters in the past and wanted them to be my go to place. I have lots of wonderful friends and we love doing things together. Needless to say all 15 of us will never see this place. This was my third appointment with them. The first time they were nice but late. We over looked that and even added on another service. The second time she was more than an hour late. My friends were there to keep me company so it wasn't so bad. However I guess that left the gates open to be a running thing. I was looking forward to this appointment as I was celebrating my favorite cousins birthday. I bought a living social for a no chip. My appointment was for 2:30. I called 3 times and text twice I want to see if I could add a fill in to my appointment. No one ever called back. Assuming I was not going to get the added service I went somewhere else for the fill in. My cousin had appointment 30 minutes before me and she tells me she is running late and do we switched. PERFECT. I called again left a message and my cousin called no answer. I arrive at 2:00 ready to get a perfect polish and I see closed sign with a clock pointing to a little before 2:15. I stayed till 2:27 no call or answer. I got my Living Social voucher refunded. I still have not gotten a return phone call from anyone. I do understand emergencies. You still were not back when you said you were and I took a cab there. By the way I'm always on time for my appointments with them. The search continues. I would rather have a mediocre nail tech that is on time with good customer service. This is no way personal I think Bianca's personality is personable and sweet. I just can't do 2 lates and a no show and still no word or apologies.

1.description: I have been going to Beautiful Sisters Nail Spa for almost two months now to get No Chip Manicures and Pedicures.  My experience each time has always been great and I've never had major issues.  I have referred many friends to this salon, as I feel their prices are unbeatable, they take their time, and does good work. My last recent visit I got a No Chip Manicure and a Pedicure.  I noticed in less than 48hrs 2 of my nails started chipping.  I was very shock to experience this so I decided to send the salon a message, along with a picture of my nails.  Less than 2hrs later, a few more nails started to lift up and I was able to literally pull all of the No Chip off my hands without soaking them.  I also messaged the salon about this as well, in hopes they would reach out to me. It has been 2days so far and I have not recieved a response regarding my issue.  I read a review here on yelp from a recent customer who seemed to have had the same issue.  I'm not sure if something was done different than in the past, but my nails have never came off unless I soaked them in acetone. I was told that I probaly won't get a response back or get my nails fixed by previous customers (one being a friend I referred), because they have had the same problems. At this moment I'm more so hurt than upset that no one has reached out to me, seeing that I was becoming a loyal customer (so I thought). Before I decided to visit this salon, I read all the not so satisfying reviews here on yelp, but it didnt deter me from trying out the salon.  I figured everyone experience is different and I needed to see for myself.  I was very pleased with their services, but not so much with their customer service skills now.  Acknowledging the problem and being willing to resolve it, is what I would have appreciated. Despite my current feelings, I still think that the ladies at this salon are talented. The biggest issue I have is them STANDING BEHIND THEIR WORK.  Anything that you specialize in and are confident about you should be able to guarantee. Needless to say, I have decided to go back to my orignal Nail Technican, whom I stopped going to due to distance. However, at this point I will make the travel sacrifice and pay the higher cost.

2.description: I was so excited to go to this salon, because of reading the reviews of it being such a great business in one of our neighborhoods. They had a livingsocial deal and I purchased it for an express no chip. I wanted to test out the place before I decided to become a regular, which would've been great since its a 10min drive from my home. I arrived and was greeted by the nail tech and her daughter. We had a great conversation and she talked about how much she and her sisters really caterers to their customers and pride themselves on customer service. I was excited because you rarely find this when visiting reasonably price nail salons. My nails looked great, I tipped and left the salon. Woke up the next day (not even 10 hours later) and 3 nails were chipped. It was a Sunday morning, so I knew they weren't open. I left a message to let them know. I figured they might not be open on Monday, so was expecting a call back by Tuesday. By that time, half of my nails had chipped. It's been over three weeks, and no one has returned my call. This isn't an example of great customer service, so I definitely will not be returning. I'll continue to travel to the north side.

9.description: Good morning ladies. I live close by & was excited 2 see a Black (sister) owned Nail Spa, around the corner. Well that excitement was short lived when I attempted 2 enjoy a mani/pedi this morning at ur spa. I called yesterday to inquire about ur business hours  & was told u open at 10:00 a.m. I drove past @ 10:00 & u were closed. I went home for a few minutes, came back, & u still were not open. I waited on the front, bcz I parked I  the side street, for about 15 min, & still no one showed up. I went to my at & sat until about 10:45. Came back 2 the shop & a lady opened the door. She asked what services I wanted & I told her a pedi. She stated there was a wait bcz of 1 person in front of me. I told her I had been waiting for since 10 & she told me, she knows, she saw me outside! I asked how long is the wait & she said an hour. I told her I couldn't wait ANOTHER hour & I left. With that being said, I received no apology or anything & felt as if if u didn't get my business, there would be others. And that is not how u want ur customers to feel. To the owners, ur already faced with the stereotypes of Black people are always late, unprofessional, etc... To me, u seem to have played right into it. I hope u take this as constructive criticism from the customer, & not as bashing. I would really like to revisit ur establishment, but I probably won't! I do wish u the best.

10.description: I just hung up from a HORRIBLE experience with this "spa".  On the phone or on hold for almost 15 minutes, called today at 5:30 pm.  Here is what happened:  I purchased a Groupon for this nail spa and scheduled an appointment.  Upon arrival the spa was closed with a sign in the window saying it was closed due to an emergency.  Not great but life happens, right?  I called the next day (Thu) left a voice mail. No response. Called again Sat, explained what happened and that I wanted to reschedule, did not give my name yet. The woman who answered went at me said that I gave them the wrong telephone number. Went on & on about the number so I asked what number she had for me. I interrupted to say that I was feeling a bit attacked.  This must have been the wrong question because I got to hear another 4-5 minutes on the phone number. I had to interrupt to say that i was really trying to find out if I could reschedule. She literally did not stop talking for another few minutes for me to give her my number or explain why this was so important that she could not schedule me without the phone number first.  My guy overheard the conversation and told me to hang up[ and get a refund, that this was unprofessional.  She then proceeded to tell me that I had a bad attitude.  WHAT THE F???  I said, I am trying to support a business of people that look like me and let's start over and reschedule.  I gave her my phone numbers and she put me on hold, only to come back after 3 minutes. Now she told me she could not continue to ARGUE with me, she has a customer in front of her and perhaps I should NOT reschedule and get a refund.  I offered again to move forward and asked if she was refusing me service.  The answer was yes.  Now she has my name so I asked her name, she refused to give me her name. WOW!!!  This was the worst phone experience I have EVER had with any business.  Especially when I was only reacting to her overly aggressive response to a customer calling to reschedule!  If she is the owner, this business will fail soon.  If she is not the owner, I hope the owner takes appropriate action.  This salon is near my mom's home and I  am a professional woman that has money to spend.  I guess I will continue to spend it elsewhere!    I cannot comment on the service, but for customer service I would give it a ZERO

4.description: So it pains me to write this review because my first experience  here was great and I hate being negative to small businesses  BUT I do feel this feedback is needed as a professional buisness  owner. I wanted to come here for months but due to time I hadn't. Finally went about a month ago. Made appt on styleseat and everything  was cool. Get to my appt and I was told it would be a wait. Cool. I waited. April did my nails and she did amazing. I also got a pedi. All no chip. Loved her and her service. No complaints about that first experience. Fast forward to 3 weeks from then,I made an appt on styleseat for a Monday and Bianca was my nail tech.  I get there and I was told I had to wait an hour. Even though  I had a appt.  Fine. So I waited for an hour and a half. I did however enjoy Bianca and her convo and passion for her craft. I got a no chip mani. MIND you my no chip pedi from April was still in tact and flawless weeks later from the first time I was there. So I got my nails the same color I had before. So that was a monday. Tuesday I noticed some lifting but it wasn't a big deal but by wed two whole nails came completely  off. So me being the nice  customer I am called the shop. Bianca answered and I politely  told her that I got my nails done on Monday and it's wed. And they are coming off and wanted to know if I could come in a get them  fixed. I was told that there was nothing that could be done about it because they don't guarantee  that no chip last. (I've had no chip before and I have never had this issue EVEr)  Then she goes on to say that I am more then welcome  to rebook for a soak off and a manicure again.and that they do this everyday all day and that it was probably  my lifestyle. (I don't do heavy labor or swim around in oils so I'm not sure why that was said to me).  I just disliked the tone and how she turned it around on me. Me being the respectful person I am I just said okay and hung up. After that phone call about 1 hour later all of my nails came off.  Safe to say 30 dollars was lost and so was a customer. I'm not saying  that I needed something for free but a apology and a we will try and fix on your next service for a discounted fee or something. As a customer you want some sort of solution to be offered not a dismissal.  The quest for a nail tech is still on. Sigh.

6.description: I loved everything about my experience here! I took my grandmother here in hopes to find a black owned and operated nail salon with great service and that's exactly what I found. Bianca did my pedicure and no chip and I am in love with the results along with the price. It was so refreshing to finally be able to feel comfortable in a salon while getting my treatment. Those other salons just wasn't doing it right. This was by far the best pedicure I have ever received! Keep in mind it took an hour but it was definitely worth it. I would recommend this place to anyone who wants their service done correctly, safely, and respectfully. I will be sure to make this place our go-to spot for our spa days.

11.description: I absolutely love this place!!! The costumer service is great. The work they do is great. The work they do is great. And you can't beat these prices.  I found my permanent nail salon. Please come check them out they are great.

5.description: In response,  I am very computer savvy and I know how to follow directions. On styleseat, it does say if an appt time is not available that you need, then to call the salon. I had done just that, which made the entire situation frustrating.   I am all for supporting black business.  This has nothing to do with racism,  its customer service.  I use yelp and styleseat often before booking anything. It made me want to come to your salon because of pictures and reviews. I understand staff may be limited and its appointment only; but maybe that note should be changed on styleseat if no one is available to answer the phone.  In the future I still hope to try your salon.

7.description: April and Bianca are sisters who own and operate a nail salon here in South Shore. It is important to them to be able to provide a spa-like experience to people in the community they live in. To this, they have a created a little oasis in this concrete jungle. The work is stellar. April's pedicures leave your feet clean and smooth and she'll let you know the health benefits of every move she makes. Bianca is an artist! Her designs are flawless and she can adapt to your personal aesthetic. Be sure to make an appointment online and to allow a few hours as they take their time and do not rush you out the door. Beautiful Sisters is a gem on East 79th Street.

8.description: The absolute best pedicure I have gotten in my 25 years of life! The salon is owned and operated by 2 (no pun intended) beautiful sisters. The salon space is set up GORGEOUSLY- its clean and professional looking. The nail tech was better than anyone I've ever encountered- she asked questions about my comfortability, any health problems & various things that I have never encountered in Asian nail salons. I had lost faith in black owned businesses but coming here my faith has been completely restored. She was patient & meticulous in doing my pedicure- and all the tools used came out of a sealed (what appeared to be sterile) pouch.  I'm recommending Beautiful Sisters to all my family & friends, & anyone looking for amazing services at extremely inexpensive prices. I'm completely blown away.

0.description: I enjoyed my services received from Beautiful Sisters. I had a pedicure done two weeks ago and the nail technician (April) did an outstanding job.  I went back two weeks later to have my nails done by other nail technician and she performed an awesome job.  I can't stop looking at my nails.   The customer service is great!!!!  I will continue to support this local business....

3.description: Awesome shop... They did a fantastic job on my braids. Very neat, friendly, affordable  & professional. I will differently be returning back here.

1.description: I went there yesterday to get senegalese twist she told me $160 over the phone. When I get there the lady ask me how much she told me. I states $160 she was like no we charge $200 so she call the lady on the phone so they arguing back & forth on the phone about price in front of the customers which is so unprofessional. So I get up about to leave another lady was there she was like please don't leave. I was like well it seems like it's problem. She was states don't worried about us we talking in our language.  She ask me how much money I had on me I told he $180. She was like we take that. I said okay so in the middle of her doing my hair she ask for  me pay her. So I did then so when lady was almost done with my hair I guess she's the owner ask to speak with me in a junky dirty closet. Telling me she didn't tell me $160 so I stated why would I drive all the way from Indiana with $180 & she wanted me to go get the rest of the money I thought that was so unprofessional. I always tip the person whoever do my hair or nails so that's why I bring $180. So the lady that was doing my hair ask me where I was going I told. I told her I was leaving she ask why so I told her. I ask for half my money back or quarter of money back  of course they wasn't going back.So I told them  they can keep my money! Just let me go! So they beg for me stay talking about you one of us & she wanted to finish my hair. Smh. The shop is dirty, messy,and junky! The tv keep going in & out. So another client & I was tring watch TV when it comes in I guess she's  owner started playing music on her phone turned it loud so we couldn't hear the tv. Smh. The lady that did my hair she was nice & did good job & I did go back & paid her the $20 but I didn't give her no tip. The owner is rude lil b$tch! The moral of story stay away from this dump it's dirty & messy. They tell you one price on the phone but it's whole another price when you get there.  The only reason I gave one star cause I had to.

2.description: This was my first time coming to this shop and I think they did a wonderful job on my twist. I would definitely be going back again!

9.description: They did a very great job, very neat and nice and very fast and they are nice and the prices are cheap

10.description: I made an appointment on Saturday for a next day appointment (Sunday morning) for Senegalese twist. The staff was very  accommodating. My twist were very neat and the service was excellent! will be returning for my touch up!

4.description: Had my hair done in this place and it's old and nasty.... The lady did a horrible job on my Mohawk.... My braids look matted when she did them and look old after only two days... Beware!!! She lie about the prices when u call and when u get there she go up.. A lady came in screaming about her sons hair I should have left then!!! She talks on several phones while servicing you... She is just flat out NASTY!!

6.description: Horrible experience! Added 2 hours to my appointment by picking up/ talking to walk-ins, box braids were neat, but extremely thin with choppy ends and CHEAP hair!

11.description: I Went here today to get my Senegal twist they did an awesome job! I recommend this place it was fast && neat && so worth it. I will be coming back to get more braids done

5.description: I get nothing but compliments for my braids. They are fast and do a great job. Josephine asked questions to ascertain exactly what I wanted. I am so glad she did because we were not thinking the same. I got box braids but I didn't want straggly tails at the end so she curled them instead. Also I misunderstood her price and gave her too much money. Lo and behold she returned the amount I overpaid. To be honest I still don't understand the price structure. Even so, I will definitely return. I forgot to mention they also took down my old braids faster than lightening. 2 people working on my head. I feel it is worth the extra money. The 4 stars rather than 5 is because of the confusing price.

7.description: This was my first time getting my hair braided in a long while so I went to this shop, when I called for pricing for senegalese twist she told me from 180-220 ok I went she settled on 200, a week later I sent my niece 4 jumbo twist she stated on the phone 150 point blank but when my niece got there she again tried to up the price to 200, my question is how in the hell is both hair styles 200 dollars? And she was suppose 2 get 30 dollars off and the braider would not honor it, no doubt in my mind poor business practices and I will not be going back...KIMBERLY

8.description: Marseillais did a Awesome job with my box braids. She didn't kill me braiding too tight! They are so pretty. Thanks!!!

0.description: Iv only been to this shop one time but I can tell you guys I will be back they are quick and neat Love my braids

3.description: Great break from the fast food joints along 79th st.  Great Oxtails and great jerk chicken.  I

1.description: As far as quantity for the price they are awesome but as for quality it seems they have good days and not so good days as far as flavor.... So I'll give a star..

2.description: Quality authentic Jamaican food on the south side.   Spicy, fresh cooked chicken made to order and well made sides.   Worth a visi!

0.description: Great jerk and couldn't be better located. The only other food around is shitty fast food and this place does a great job of offering quality food, somewhat fast. It's located east of the 79th red line, just a few stops on the 79 bus.The chicken is made to order and the rub has a great flavor, a mild-medium spice. All the sides are prepared throughout the day in place in front of you. The greens are so tasty with a nice combination of savory, salty, and just a little bitter left in them. Can't go wrong with the sweet potatoes either (they call them yams), which were loaded with cinnamon and a great almost dessert. The lunch plates come with an entree, rice & beans, two sides, a piece of white bread, and (hot) sauce. I thought it was a great deal under $10 with how much even fast food charges for junk.Best things about this spot: you can support a local business, get some deliciously marinated meat, and some quality sides that remind you of mom. I wouldn't call the food healthy in any respect but I would definitely call it good!

3.description: I am a big proponent of good customer service. Family owned businesses typically provide the best customer service.   I was drawn here by a 50% off coupon but I know I will return.  It might not be a great neighborhood but you can generally get a free parking space on the street out front.   I'll spend my $ here from now on.

1.description: I just left this hardware store, and I must say I am impressed...which does not happen often. This hardware store has that small town family feel, without having exorbitant prices, which I highly appreciate. I was assisted throughout the process by young lady named Felice, who was professional yet very friendly. I was also assisted by a gentleman in the back with whatever I needed and asked if I had questions and promptly answered them and showed me exactly where I needed to go to get the items I needed.Another gentleman went above and beyond in looking online for other types of organizational bins and drawers for me that they may carry. I actually bought more than I ever intended when I walked in!
