I came there for a box cutter, and left with almost $400 worth of organizational supplies, cleaning products, and items to stock our warehouse.Jerome also very kindly and efficiently took all of my many boxes, bags, bins, etc. to my car and loaded them in there for me. The only reason I took away one star is because the store is slightly tight and a bit cluttered, but not dirty. Mostly because the young lady that rang me up seemed to be a bit off-kilter. She treated another gentleman and lady (prior to my check out) with a bit of condescension and seemed a bit abrupt with them. Although she did not treat me that way, I feel customer service and respect is of the utmost importance in any establishment. Overall, I rate this business highly and will definitely be going back (regularly) for supplies as needed.

2.description: Really the only hardware store in the neighborhood. What I like,  unlike home depot is the employee's ask "Can I help you find what your looking for"  I do a lot of rehab in this area and they seem to have a lot of the small items I'm looking for.

5.description: This is a pretty decent sized hardware store and not too ghetto considering the neighborhood it's in. I come here to buy nails, masking tape, wire.....you know, the basics for making art projects.My favorite thing about this store? There are usually two employees standing inside the entrance waiting to ask you what you're looking for! Why can't more stores be like this?

0.description: Good location, Friendly Employees, Neiborhood friendly ! Good people to do business with !

4.description: Good store, very nice and friendly owner. I can always find what I need from here.

3.description: this McDonald's service is horrible. Last time i was in here i waited 20 minutes for cold greasy food. How do you wait that long for cold food? Due to shitty service here i Will never eat here or McDonald's period.

1.description: I've stopped here probably 20 times on my way to work.  The food is fine, and I've never actually been inside, but the drive-thru is hit-or-miss.  Sometimes, you get through quickly, but others, it takes over ten minutes to get through and get a coffee!  When I have time, I prefer to drive over to the Starbucks at 71st and Stony Island, but McDonald's works for a quick stop.

2.description: Where do I begin. Ok let's see from the moment you pull up it starts. The young lady ask what my order is I give it to her twice and she still can't comprehend what I said, then I get to the pay window which is disgusting have never been cleaned since forever another nasty stink attitude these people are just plain rude. The service here is horrible not only do they serve your food out of a nasty drive thru which glass looks like a million hands has been on it but they're just plain mean. I guess the only reason they're here is because of the location and the money that they're making off the black people in that area!!! Don't waste your time here. I rather drive to a different location than go to this one and this one is closer to my house :(

0.description: This McDonald's has multiple personalities. At times, they're super fast and helpful; at other times you might be in the drive-thru all day while you watch them help all the customer who are in line inside. Generally everything is a-ok, though.
Not the best but its not the worst..just another walgreen

3.description: Great customer service from knowledgeable practioners. I've found a new place to shop.

1.description: I've been going to this place for years and I have yet to have a bad experience. They are very helpful and extremely knowledgeable about their products and about improving your hair. So they have given the best product selections. Everything I have bought from them actually worked like they told me it would. Great place to go!!

2.description: I agree with all.  I went in once last summer to do a haul of hair products before moving to Portland and I experienced the best customer service I have experienced on Chicago's South side than I can ever remember in all my life.  Instead, of re-stocking my products on the internet, I will be making a stop to Jordan's on my next trip! Great staff, please keep up the excellent work!

5.description: Their service is great and their choice of quality products are unbeatable. Whenever I need professional hair products Jordan's Beauty Supply is the place for me. You can't go wrong here they have everything you need from products to ceu classes.

6.description: Jordan's is hands down the best beauty supply in Chicago.  The staff is friendly and extremely knowledgable about all of their products.

0.description: Hello!  BLACK OWNED  BEAUTY SUPPLY!  And staff actually trained in the products?  And an incredible range of products, including many that are usually only available at salons?Paydirt, people!  There's a new location west, as well, but this is worth the trip.

4.description: I often get overwhelmed when I walk into this beauty supply because there are such a wide variety of products. As a cosmetology student or professional, you get a huge discount and you save so much money rather than going to your neighborhood beauty supply. They sell dozens of professional brands and their customer service is great as well. Oh yea, they offer classes to students and professionals. I effin' LOVE this place!  :)

0.description: omg. How come no one has reviewed this place?? I love, love, love their chinese food. It's my staple in chinese food restaurants. I mean, aside from all the dishes being textbook 101 chinese fast food. Their portions are HUGE and their prices are awesome. I've moved from the neighborhood before, and can never find a chinese food place that holds a candle to this one. Everywhere else is either always so expensive or their portions are off, or the food just doesn't taste as well. I love their combo platters, 1 combo meal could feed 2 people easy. Or if you're adventurous and all, eat it all yourself. The crab rangoons are great. And they don't put peas in their fried rices! Sorry. That just really irks me when places do.

58.description: There should be 3.5 stars because that is exactly what I would give here. There are two good places to get your produce in this side of Hyde Park: HPP or Treasure Island. I like HPP better than TI because it is relatively inexpensive and quality of food is pretty good.Thumbs up:1. Fruits and Produce: who can resist fresh and bright veggies? They even have karela (Indian bitter gourd).2. Quality and selection: as opposed to other grocery stores they have tremendous varieties of produce and they all are of good quality. Nothing goes bad for weeks.3. inexpen$ive: although things are of good quality, they are not as expensive as in TI.4. Staff are friendly also.Thumbs down: 1. Selection of meat: whats up with that? I almost always have to go to TI to get meat because any kind of meat is super expensive here.2. Selection of pasta: limited packets of pasta available.But for produce  it is numero uno!!! Go HPP!!!

56.description: Very good produce, dairy products, baked goods, and a good delicatessen section too. I'm hooked. The prices are more than reasonable.  The staff know what they are doing and are committed to their work. Yes, there is life in Hyde Park!

29.description: This is one of the best markets I've ever patronized. I used to shop in the old location when they were in a tiny store front. Now that they have expanded, it is even better. It has a wonderful mix of nice imported, prepared foods as well as extremely good and inexpensive produce. This is a great one stop shop for most of your grocery needs, and is definitely preferable to alternatives in the neighborhood. The staff is pretty friendly.

42.description: Great little grocery in Hyde Park. We shopped there for some basics (fresh veggies, butter, eggs, half & half). I found the prices to be okay and the veggie selection to be fresh. No complaints!

23.description: This is a really nice store and I enjoy the variety that is there however, the produce is not too consistent sometimes good and sometimes it's bad. When it comes to the other items in the grocery store they are kind of pricey...but I understand it's a small neighborhood store and I want to give back to small businesses. Customer service is nice. Overall they try to keep the store clean.

47.description: This place has great selection and really competitive prices. Non-produce selection is limited though, for example... no angel food cake mix

8.description: This place made my weekend! Having only been shopping on 55th's Treasure Island  and Open Produce, I really wanted to check out what Hyde Park Produce offers. Initially, I didn't even go in with a basket. I thought to myself I am just going to browse. However, as soon as I got in, I saw the $2.99/ lb Rainier cherries and the $1.49 for a 16oz. fresh organic strawberries. I had to read and re-read the signs to make sure I was reading correctly. I even waived down a customer service person to help me read the signs. So yes, things are cheap here. I quickly grabbed a basket thinking that I may only walk away with a few things.As I continued down the aisles, I found that the one drink that I have been looking for all summer last year in Maryland. The blueberry soda. OMG! This place carries it. I grabbed the last bottle and heard that they will stock it up again soon. So excited! So, yes this place offers really unique things. Another product that I got was the pink lady apple juice. I love pink lady apples, so we'll see how I like this drink.The deli/ cheese section is also very good. They have a good nice selection. The servers behind the counter are also very helpful and nice.I love, love this place!

31.description: This place is in a convenient area, and the inside looks a lot nicer than the outside leads you to believe. Produce section is actually pretty good and some of the prices in the veggie aisle are not too bad. The prices on the raw meat on the other hand? Atrocious. Place is pretty expensive for most things but there isn't much to choose from in the area with the lack of super markets and grocery stores. All in all, if you are too lazy to drive further or you don't mind spending a bit more coin, then this place is acceptable.

34.description: I remember this location from years ago, when it was a nothing-special, run down supermarket. Friends had recommended it over the past couple of years and I finally went back recently. It's just become my every-day choice for fresh groceries.Produce is clearly their focus. Fruit and vegetables are high quality and re-stocked frequently. Organics are available for many things, but not all. There's usually a mark-down bin for "use it right away" stuff like yesterday's ripe bananas. Variety is not vast but fully adequate, seasonal, with a few out-of-the-way items you won't find elsewhere.  They have the best fresh herb section I've seen outside of Whole Paycheck.Prices are much better than other stores I've tried in Chicago. That goes for pre-packaged items like juices and dairy too, not just the fresh produce area.Bakery is decent. I can't always find unsliced whole grain bread, but that may be my fault for tending to shop late in the day. My guess is that they ship everything in daily, rather than having some items finish-baked on site like some stores.Deli is your standard Boar's Head slice-o-mat. If you want grab-and-eat, you can get a better sandwich a few blocks away at Jimmy John's or Potbelly for about the same price.Fish selection is minimal and shrinkwrapped, which is the biggest drawback for me. I wish there were a butcher or seafood shop around the corner like in olden days.This is a grocery store. Don't expect it to double as a corner druggist and light hardware store the way some chain stores do.I haven't been going long, but I've been impressed by the service. Friendly but no nonsense. My kind of place.

16.description: This is a really nice store and I enjoy the variety that is there however, the produce is not too consistent sometimes good and sometimes it's bad. When it comes to the other items in the grocery store they are kind of pricey...but I understand it's a small neighborhood store and I want to give back to small businesses. Customer service is nice. Overall they try to keep the store clean.

13.description: This place is in a convenient area, and the inside looks a lot nicer than the outside leads you to believe. Produce section is actually pretty good and some of the prices in the veggie aisle are not too bad. The prices on the raw meat on the other hand? Atrocious. Place is pretty expensive for most things but there isn't much to choose from in the area with the lack of super markets and grocery stores. All in all, if you are too lazy to drive further or you don't mind spending a bit more coin, then this place is acceptable.

11.description: The best grocery shop in Hyde Park (not that there's a lot of them :P). Veggies and fruits are fresh and really cheap, other things are also not too expensive (for sure cheaper than in Treasure Island). And I love their blueberry muffins!!!

39.description: This is a gem in Hyde Park, and their fresh, cheap, diverse selection of produce is why you come here. Plus, the staff are always so friendly and helpful. Brandon behind the deli counter is awesome--he always has a smile and asks how your day is going.Five stars for their selection, for the produce prices, and for the all around atmosphere

37.description: Bottom line: Cheap-as-HELL produce whose quality far outstrips anything at Jewel, Dominick's, or even Treasure Island on a good day--and for significantly less money.  The only downside is that a lot of the dry goods are ridiculously overpriced (or are imports that will cost more anyway: $17 olive oil and the like), so it can be hard to do all of your shopping at HPP if you're on a budget.  Deli counter's competitively priced and offers the usual range of cold cuts and cheeses plus some more exotic fare.  The meat case leaves something to be desired, as does their bread selection.  You can find some interesting dessert items from the former Soviet bloc that are fairly affordable.  The cheap and fresh produce is the real reason to hit up this store, though.Other pros: -the staff are super friendly and remember you.-there's often a nun camped out in the front of the store selling delicious baked goods.  Hyde Park randomness at its very best.

0.description: This place is sooo amazing. I'm pissed I didn't know about it before now as I usually visit Kimbark next door. They have everything you need (within reason) -- quality produce, meat, a deli with Boar's head (the best meat around), and did I mention the produce? They have a good selection of hard to find items as well, which one can always appreciate.The service was great on my way in, through checkout, and on my way out. The cashier was genuinely interested in my experience!And bonus was I didn't go broke trying to shop. This is definitely my new go-to!

38.description: In my previous review I may have been a bit harsh.  Hyde Park is down to two choices for groceries: Treasure Island and Hyde Park Produce... Despite the lack of choices if you live in Hyde Park it is almost impossible not to frequent these two places.  Truth is you can find better, fresher, more varied produce in Treasure Island, albeit at a much higher price!  I continue to frequent Hyde Park Produce because you can dash in and dash out with a quick fix, and sometimes be very surprised at a special.  The deli has a great selection of Boar's Head meats and cheeses.  They also carry an excellent selection of artisan breads (sour dough, challah, bagels, brioche, pita, French, Italian) ...not that they bake, but from various suppliers who are quite good.  Rounding our their inventory are European butters, Cabot cheeses, pasteurized eggs, and the usual canned pantry items that are way over priced.  They carry a variety of organic meats if you don't mind spending $8 for one lonely chicken breast.  So as frequently as I find myself in and out of its doors, I have to recommend it as a usual stop, and you should check it out too.  It's a good place, and it has good things, just not everything.  Sometimes the produce looks a little sad, not always but sometimes.  More often than not you will be pleased with your visit.  Hypercritically yours...  Below are my most recent tips:Good selection of breads11oz box blueberries .99 cents!Fruit & Deli fix!Try the pesto and guacamole in the deli!  Meanwhile I'm a big fan of lo carb/hi fiber breads from Today's Temptations, they carry them!Fruit fix!  They also have fresh squeezed orange juice!  Good guacamole, and fresh home made pesto!Fruit fix to dilute my burgerPerfect Day for a fruit fixNice assortment of artisanal breads for the "carboholic" in you!  Bagels, ciabatta, demi baguettes, sour dough, naan, pita, challah, and the list goes on...1/2 off floral bouquets today!Found basil plants for $1.79!  They are $4.98 at Treasure Island.  I am hit & miss w/this store but it's convenient!They have Parmigiano Reggiano but clerk says "it's not cut & I don't cut the cheese, so come back tomorrow.Only place nearby that has Silk Soy Creamer... Great home made pesto, & guacamole...also Boars Head meats

51.description: I am really glad HPP is in Hyde Park. I much prefer this place to Treasure Island. The produce is fantastic, and the staff is usually pretty friendly. I can purchase an entire bag stuffed full of produce for less than $20.00. HPP is pretty great!

27.description: Great place for produce, and good prices. You can always find exotic fruits there. The sandwiches at the deli counter are great and come with a bag a chips! This is the only place I've ever seen sell Boar's Head hummus which is amazing. Also they sell cobra corn, which is some amazing popcorn. They have a good selection of organic/ethical/green meat, but never have conventional meat, so its great for good quality food, but not for cheap meat. The employees are always very nice, and sometimes there are nuns selling fresh baked goods with delicious homemade meringues. And you can get herbs in whatever quantity you want, which is way cheaper than every other grocery store.

32.description: Horrid. What a cluster F***. Impossible to find what you need and they don't carry most regular products that you'd need. Wanted to try them out but left with more then half my list not done. Waste of time.Have to update my review. Cut open a red potato to find it ROTTEN in the middle. Totally black and disgusting. Open my shredded cheese today and it had MOLD in it. It said best by Jan 2014. I WILL NEVER GO TO THIS DISGUSTING PLACE AGAIN. I should get my money back!!!

54.description: A good place to buy fresh produce, nothing else. The produce is ridiculously cheap - way cheaper than Wal-Mart. They have more organic options than most places, but everything is not always super fresh.There is also a decent grocery selection (especially for cheese and bread). The deli counter food is okay, but nothing special (the fried plantains are pretty delicious). The non-produce items are comparatively pricey (but not for Hyde Park).

48.description: I don't quite get all the hype for this place.They are cheap and you definitely get a lot of bang for your buck, but it's moot when you have to throw your produce away 2 days after you bought it because it's rotten. They do have a large selection, and you can probably find almost anything here.If you have time to go there daily or every other day and buy just what you need for the next day or two, then this would be your haven. But don't plan on buying a week's worth of produce on Sunday and expect to be using it on Friday.On the flipside, their deli counter is fairly decent (try their fresh salsa) and they do have semi-cheap staples like milk and eggs (cheaper than neighboring CVS anyway). For that, they get an extra star.

44.description: I love this produce store it is inexpensive and they have a varitey of fruit and veggies!I would say to anyone these days I wouldn't buy a lot of fresh fruit and veggies these days because they don't last no matter where you get them from!At least when I get them here I know they are fresh and they taste great!The store is clean and the staff is friendly!

24.description: - Fantastic produce at good prices- Very pleasant shopping experience (store layout, size and presentation etc.)- Extremely friendly and helpful staff- Good deli and premade selection- Pricey and limited, but high qualilty dry goods selectionIf the prices of non-produce items were a bit cheaper I would definitely give this place 5 stars. So glad to have them in the neighborhood! Now we just need a Trader Joe's to balance it out.

7.description: Worst experience ever, don't come here for fresh fruits. We've brought a watermelon, thinking it's fresh and they go along with their slogan: "fresh fruits and vegetable daily"Total lie.We've cut up this particular watermelon, to come to find out it's rotten and totally disgusting. The cashier did not have us out receipt. I called and email customer service. The customer service didn't get back to us until 8 days later!!!She said she'll handled us herself but there was another manager on duty who wanted to take care of us. We got there, the manager was rude... Whatever. Anyhow they gave us a replacement watermelon which is great but the watermelon wasn't ready and the watermelon we've received was extremely small. The watermelon we're originally brought & paid for, was extremely huge! That's why we got it!Honesty tho, the store isn't a great customer service grocery store and they don't provide the consumer true to their slogan statement. They need to work on their timely manner and the rude customer service they have gave us. We're never coming here again. "Fresh fruits and vegetable?" What a lie.

49.description: Really convenient (for me at least), the staff is very friendly and always willing to help.  The produce is fresh and super affordable and they have a surprisingly good selection considering the space.  Much preferred to Treasure Island, this is the supermarket to frequent in Hyde Park.

40.description: This place is great! The produce is inexpensive and in good condition. The lines aren't long and the people who work there are helpful. I love that I can shop for produce in my neighborhood now.

53.description: hyde parks saving grace. cheapest produce in the area, fantastic service, overal fantastic establishment.

30.description: The employees are always helpful and friendly. They shop is clean, and the selection is good for a place it's size (medium). However, their selection is limited in a lot of major ways, especially with more generic items. Also, it's pricey to shop there. The location is good, especially when there's not much in the neighborhood, near restaurants and a cvs. Overall, good place to shop, but could be better and more affordable.

46.description: Great fresh vegetables and fruits, good cheap prices. It smells heavenly. I wish I still lived down the street from it. They have cheap cut-up watermelon in the summer. : )

1.description: Fresh produce at a decent price. Friendly cashiers. Cheese selection is astounding!Not good for packaged foods, unfortunately it's better to go to Treasure Island for that.

55.description: Great variety of fresh produce!  I get all my fruits and vegetables here.  I love the wide variety of delicious fruits and vegetables.  They have great sales (organic strawberries for $1.99!).Also, the store is clean and well-light, and the staff is always friendly and helpful.  Total Hyde Park gem right here!

9.description: Yesssss I love hyde park produce!If you want a really unassuming, good sandwich, the deli is fresh and the staff is friendly. You also get a piece of fruit with your lunch!The produce is super cheap, but the packaged goods are really pricey. I always get my pita bread from here though--only like two bucks.THE TRAIL MIX IS JUST SO GOOD THOUGH. Seriously. I hate raisins but I love the raisins in this trail mix. I dream about these nuts and berries.

26.description: So cute.  The store is smallish, but it's spread out enough.  They're always sampling cheese, so that's a big plus.  Produce, bread, canned goods, dairy...everything, just great all around.  There is rarely a long wait, and the employees are friendly and helpful.

25.description: Convenient if you're just picking up a staple or something you forgot at the real grocery store. Prices seem high and they don't seem to have much outside the produce section, which is the largest part of the store. Hot bar is pretty good if you catch them early before the plantains dry out. Good service from the workers back there though. They always prompt me to try them first if they think they look a little dry. 1/3 times they were edible and delicious. Store is a navigational nightmare though.

12.description: I LOVE Hyde Park Produce!! This small, neighborhood produce market offers fresh quality produce and a decent size selection of health foods and international foods. The staff is friendly and approachable and the prices are JUST RIGHT. They also have a nice hot bar and cold bar. Each day they have fresh sushi provided by The SitDown (next door) so you can get your quick sushi fish and KNOW that its fresh and yummy. Hyde Park Produce may not be "as good as it gets," but its pretty darn close!

59.description: 69 CENT AVOCADOS?  That got me.  As the name suggests, this place is amazing for produce.  Eggs and milk are also great, but processed foods are pretty overpriced.

21.description: This place is ok I'd you're  like me and just need eggs, fruit etc. It's over priced I'd You're trying to feed a family of 5. The hot bar is good but would be better if the didn't serve the same sides and meat everyday. But I'm still a loyal customer if that means anything. Lol...

17.description: I love HPP! Great produce at great prices. And the staff is helpful and pleasant.

10.description: Huh, really surprised by the good reviews. Overall impression from shopping here all the time (due to proximity) is that while the produce section might be cheaper than the other closest grocery store in the area (Treasure Island), the quality is lacking. Fruits (esp. apples) often appear to have gone through some rough times in transport as a lot of them are bruised and scarred. Vegetables noticeably age a lot faster than produce from Treasure Island (esp. herbs). The one thing I really like is that they have Valentina Sauce, my absolute favorite Mexican salsa picante. Almost tempted to up one star, but will refrain from biased reviews.

5.description: Decently priced store in the neighborhood especially for fresh produce. The selection for chips and other grocery staples is average. They have a good variety of organic foods if that is what you are looking for. Dairy and cheese selection is impressive.

3.description: I shop here because of convenience and nothing more. Produce quality is inconsistent and grocery items are incredibly overpriced. I'm sure the owners feel they can charge for such convenience and having such a captive audience. One of the things that bothers me the most is that many of the cashiers wear rubber food service gloves while handling money. The gloves look dirty, many have holes in them, so they are not changed out (magic gloves, if you will). Then they are handling my produce, groceries, bags etc. I get it, money is gross...but CHANGE YOUR GLOVES. Dirty gloves do not help anyone I adore supporting local businesses, but for my grocery needs, I am counting the days until Whole Foods opens down the street. Better product, more variety and definitely more helpful and customer focused staff. Also, salad bar.I will be sorry to see a local neighborhood grocery store go out of business when a large corporate vendor moves in down the street, but I feel you brought it on yourself.

35.description: Good prices but the quality is bad....not better than Jewel or Dominicks at all. The store is decently clean, small is size and it's hard to do a full shop there...None of the produce or products are organic so that's a downer. The store deserves a 1 star just based on the service, quality and standards. There are much better options...The rating it has here is unjust for sure. It makes me think it's fabricated.

19.description: Horrid. What a cluster F***. Impossible to find what you need and they don't carry most regular products that you'd need. Wanted to try them out but left with more then half my list not done. Waste of time.Have to update my review. Cut open a red potato to find it ROTTEN in the middle. Totally black and disgusting. Open my shredded cheese today and it had MOLD in it. It said best by Jan 2014. I WILL NEVER GO TO THIS DISGUSTING PLACE AGAIN. I should get my money back!!!

28.description: This place is fantastic. The produce is vast and expansive. The prices for the produce are really very decent. You can get some deals on perishable items but you can also break the bank on others. Check out the bagels: they are 3 bucks for six huge and delicious bagels. They also cary the Middle Easter pitta bread I love, which is also under 3 bucks. If you hit this place at the right time of the day, they have a table of samples such as meat, cheese, crackers, and cookies. I may or may not have made a mini meal out of the samples here. The employees are so very kind and although it is usually very busy, the check out process is generally quick. Living in HP, one will know HPP and Treasure Island are the only grocery markets (which will change after the Whole Foods is built next year). With that said, I would recommend HPP for produce and take the 6 up to Roosevelt Road's Jewel or Trader Joes for other products and name brands.

45.description: They're the best! They have great deals on your regular apples and bananas, etc. They also have things you would never expect throughout the store - banana flowers, the world's best almond cookies, incredible salami, and more. Recommended!

33.description: They have a LARGE, fresh variety of produce but a limited specialty grocery. Mostly international products. I'm adding a star bc they carry "Calypso Lemonade" : my favorite drink.

43.description: Lots of fresh stuff at cheap prices! I love it here. I opted for cheaper produce today, but I got lots to last me the week! Entire bunches of fresh herbs for cheap. It's like organic shopping without the ridiculous markups. This is the way grocery shopping should be.

2.description: The food is fairly priced and the staff is always friendly! After several bad experiences with Treasure Island, I'm more than glad to make the switch.  Bonus: supporting local business!

18.description: Love this place! I zip through and get everything I need at great prices, pay the total bill plus  $3 and voila! My groceries are delivered to my top-storey walk-up!

41.description: I love this place. My dad used to take me here every weekend. Try their salsa and guacamole. They make it fresh whenever it runs out(happens a lot on the weekends). I also love the french nuns that visit every weekend(I think it's every Sunday or Saturday), they have freshly baked pastries, I love their lemon tarts.

52.description: I was in a hurry and was just in and out because I needed a loaf of bread, and because the Farmer's Market I had meant to go to now has a construction site in its place. Well, the bread bit was disappointing because--I'll be honest--I am cheap when it comes to buying bread and they charge regular prices for it.I scooted around picking up the produce that I came in for, and in the process I noticed something exciting--this store carries products from local farms and producers! I saw LocalFolks mustard and salsa, from a family farm in Sheridan Indiana, as well as Sassy Cow Ice Cream from a Wisconsin creamery. I picked up the ice cream, and I need you to know that this green tea ice cream has FIVE ingredients in it! When have you ever had ice cream with only five ingredients? Well hurry and go get some; it tastes like cream and sweet tea and nothing else, and it's so smooth you almost don't even have to swallow it.I'l be returning when I have more time just to look for more local treats like this. Oh yeah, and their reasonably priced, plentiful fruits and veggies,

50.description: This place has always been my favorite place for fruits, vegetables, and cheese.  Truly the most inexpensive place in Hyde Park, I dont exceed $10-15 for everything on my list: tomatoes, mushrooms, romaine, watermelon, bananas, grapes, avocado, corn, peppers, jalapenos, cucumber, spinach, nectarines, garlic, ginger, honey, tomato bread, and freshly shredded cheddar. A nice French port may set you back a few bucks, as will the fresh salmon fillets, but you really do pay for quality, not quantity and can actually taste the difference. Not a big red meat eater anymore but the steaks are good but kind of pricey. Guacamole and salsa are made fresh among other items in the deli, but I usually go after those two first. learning to make my own would probably be alot less expensive.  Overall my go-to spot for fresh produce.

4.description: Great cheap produce. I come here once a week to pick up a week's worth of produce, and usually walk out paying under $20 (try doing that at treasure island..). The fruit here is great. Sure it may not be like 10000% organic, but whatever, it is good. Mangoes here sometimes go for like 2 for $1, which is when I stock up on them and let them ripen. The asian pears are also delicious and cheaper than anywhere else I've seen. The potatoes here tend to sprout pretty quickly (within 10 days), but just eat them quickly.They DO have an organic section (I get the carrots, swiss chard and kale) if you want some of that.If you want to buy produce, I highly recommend coming here (and also eating at Cedar's next door)!.

6.description: Pros: -Large variety of produce, including carambolas (seasonal), heirloom tomatoes, dragonfruit on occasion, etc.-Most of the produce is pretty cheap, and certainly much cheaper than the chain groceries in Chicago-They have all of the basics. If you're cooking a meal from scratch, you'll likely be able to find every ingredient. -They carry some high end specialty products (e.g., non-wheat flours, stone ground matcha green tea powder, vanilla beans, gluten free cookies)-There are a few things that are better priced here than chain stores. For example, kerrygold reserve cheddar cheese is 4.29 here, but runs 5.00-8.50 at other grocery stores. Organic milk and free range omega 3 eggs are also cheaper than what you'd expect at a chain.-The staff is ALWAYS nice-They carry bread from Medici, a local bakery/restaurantCons:-It's a neighborhood market, and they don't carry a lot of national brands. If you're trying to get Cheerios and Coca Cola, you'll have to head next door to CVS-Sometimes the produce available is ready to be eaten THAT day. Just make sure you look at what you're getting and feel it for its consistency-It's a little bit small and can get crowded on weekends or after work. I avoid peak hours-There are a few products that seem more expensive here than elsewhere, such as rice. It could also be that they're selling a different quality of rice, but I'm usually just looking for cheap when it comes to rice-I once saw a block of cheese in the deli specialty cheese section that was expired. If it's a food that doesn't see a lot of turnover, check the expiration date-Meat is expensive. Then again, this has helped me keep my meat consumption down.Overall, this is my favorite place to shop in Hyde Park. For the few items that they don't carry, I can usually get them at CVS right next door.

22.description: This place rocks! good produce, nice deli and nice selection of grocery dairy frozen items also Amish chicken.  Great independent business

15.description: This place has the tiniest selection of goods I have ever seen. You want a bag of chips, here is one brand that makes  4 different varieties. Same with the selection of cereal, dairy products, etc.  It is really only good for the necessities like eggs and milk.  Plus it is always crowded since the store is small and it is hard to find what you are looking for.

57.description: Found this place about 10 years ago when I lived in Hyde Park.  This was a wonderful place for fresh vegetables and fruit.

20.description: Love this little store, it's a small store with a big heart. They have everything including an organic section, deli, hot food and fresh squeezed juice. I go there once or twice a week. The staff is over the top friendly, if you're visiting hyde park I highly recommend shopping there for your needs.

36.description: I love HPP! The fresh fruits and vegetables are surprisingly cheap. They also have a deli counter and cheese bar. The desserts are quite fantastic too, and I like how you can find many obscure packaged foods from different countries as well as local bread. The only downside is that the lines are pretty long, but they do move fast.

14.description: So you probably shouldn't shop in the aisles Here because they obviously make their money by gouging you on grocery items. BUT! The produce is great here! And affordable! Found great deals on items that are hard to find: Serrano peppers, fennel, honeycrisp apples, and fresh herbs. Will definitely be back!

3.description: Thursday, December 18, 2014 as I approached the counter and placed my order, one of the foreign employees told his co-worker "the nigger want a polish".  We had some words afterwards.  I then called the police but left before they arrived.  I will be going to the appropriate police station to follow up.Jerome TaylorHammond, Indiana773.837.7287

1.description: This place is horrible after telling the guy 5 times I wanted a hotdog with melted cheese and raw onion and a cup of cheese for the fries - I went back to my vehicle to eat. I got a hotdog with a slice of cheese not even melted with a half of onion on it. I then took it up to the window and told they guy I wanted the melted cheese on the hot dog he then argues with me that's how I ordered it with the slice cheese and That's how they always make them I was like I want the melted cheese he repeats that's not how they make them- smh You have the cheese how about making it  how I WANT!! I told the guy so what I have to pay extra for the cups of cheese and add it to the hotdog myself he said Yes so I said hold on while I get My $ A Man in line said that's ok heres a $ so I told the guy I wanted the 2 cups of cheese  he then tells Me off and refused to serve Me. So a few of the customers said that was bulls$$t and left also . So while then eating My hotdog I got begged for change then I seen a fight at the bus stop right in front of the place!! I WILL NEVER GO TO THIS PLACE AGAIN AND IT REALLY GIVES MAXWELL ST PLACES A BAD NAME!!!

2.description: Do NOT eat here. Under new management, which BLOWS! Let me tell you why.1. The menu is inaccurate. Prices are sloppily taped over old ones, and even those are inaccurate; be prepared to pay whatever the guy inside wants to charge.2. There used to be both a walk up window and an indoor carry out window; now there's only a walk up. They give no shits about customers' safety or comfort.3. The service, if you want to call it that, is hellish at best. The guy working the window literally said "I don't care, never come back" to my face when I called him on the price differences. The previous management was much nicer and more honest. This place under the new people is a piece of shit, compared to other Maxwell-style grills, and that's saying something. The bulletproof glass has holes in it for a reason. Roll on by.

5.description: They had the absolute best gyros on the southside, everyone i took there agreed, but this business is now closed.

0.description: One of the only places that is 24 hours. After hours you have to wait outside which is why they have only 4 stars. I only tried the polish here and it was different to say the least. It has 50 different flavors once you bite into the polish. I LOVE the fresh fries that they have here. Really great place to stop by for a bite after a night out

4.description: Your standard Maxwell Street Depot, but as opposed to other locations they have fresh cut fries, which puts them a cut above. This being on 79th, the counter is well protected with an airlock for your food set in a thick bulletproof glass window, with the hilarious side effect that the cooks, already disadvantaged in comprehending your order for other reasons, must engage you in a clumsy shouting exchange to confirm it.Stop by, get a polish and fries, smile!

3.description: This place is AWESOME!!  I got here for all of my Caribbean needs.  They carry African, Dominican and Puerto Rican fare.  Jamaican items are here as well.  Every time I need dough for empanadas or turkey necks for fried cabbage, I go there.  It is reasonably priced and the workers are very helpful and friendly.

1.description: I visit this place as often as I can! The staff is always so kind and friendly, from the butchers to the cashiers! I can always find exotic things to cook and flavor my food with. I love this place!

2.description: I enjoy coming here because I can always find something in here from different areas of the world. You can always find yummy plantains and coconuts and other island foods...try it out

0.description: A real neighborhood gem. This Mexican Caribbean/ African  storefront market has Is as diverse as this Southside neighborhood . They have fresh produce, a meat counter, and groceries ranging from African palm oil and stockfish to goat and fish flavor bouillon cubes. Occupying two storefronts ( with the wall knocked out in between) La Fruteria is a clean  and friendly glorified corner store . Staff is friendly and helpful .

3.description: Dirty inside and sometime shady looking fools are hanging inside. Good chopped steak sandwich but watch the guy because he will get your order wrong.

1.description: I love this place ! It might not look all that great but I really like the food and that is the ONLY place I will get cheese sticks .

2.description: Awesome food..Quick...but there are always people hanging in the establishment...makes you feel a bit uncomfortable....

0.description: Good cheap and greasy...they every thing u can think of beefs, chicken, subs, and a large variety of beverages (non alcoholic)

3.description: My dad been taking me to there with my family since when I was little kid. Owner know my dad since 1980's. Loncar's french fries, chicken, colesaw and hot sauce is so fucking good! When we going to Calumet Park beach, my dad always stop at Loncar's to take out for picnic. its part of my childhood memories, I will visit it again someday! :)

1.description: Great "Workingmans Lunch Counter"/ Bar in the "Land that time forgot"!!  Food is good, prices are dirt cheap, patrons are shady and the service is just fine.. NO WINDOWS!!! Ha ha- Get dat did

2.description: This place was ok....nothing special.  I only went there to try the fried chicken that I'd heard about.  The atmosphere was that of a bar.  The customers were into the Bear's game and were cool.  As for the chicken, it was better than KFC, but that's about it.  I hear it sucks since the new owners took over.

5.description: I don't like given reviews less then 3 stars, but I have to keep it real and true to my fan base.  I do have fans, don't I ;pAnyways, after exposing my good friend Dean to the other local fried chicken joint, I decided it was time we gave Loncar's a try.I haven't eaten Loncar's chicken in a long while, and they are under new management now, but I now know why we mostly ate from the other place.First of all, my chicken wing had a feather on it.  No big deal.  I don't freak out about that kind of stuff, but still.  It's the principle of the matter.  Secondly, the flavoring of the chicken was just lacking.  It seemed like the chicken was just breaded, no seasoning added or anything.Thirdly, the cuts of chicken had too many fatty pockets and other excess fat that could have/should have been removed.Finally, the bread rolls didn't seem fresh.  They were dry and hard.I guess growing up on chicken from the other place has set my standards high.  I will say that the fries were tasty.As always, I will try anything twice.... So I will go back and update this review.  My sister married the nephew of the owners.  So I'm sure they'll hear about my review.  I hope they don't take it the wrong way.I will also like to comment, that the bar area did look 'shady' as someone else mentioned, but it's a cool looking 'dive' like atmosphere. The craziest thing is that you can buy liquor from the refrigerator section or from the bar tender.  Kinda neat if you ask me.  Plus I'm told this is one of the only places you can find a drink koozie for a 40. ;p

6.description: This is one of those scary bars that doesn't have windows. It took a while for me to get the up the courage to actually go in. It's not that bad.Cheap beer and drinks. Interesting locals. Jukebox. I recently "confessed" to a co-worker that I hadn't had fried chicken since high school. She was appalled and the next week we were eating fried chicken and fries at Loncar's. Not great, not bad but it got the job done. Fact: I was hit on here by a guy with 3 fingers. He also serenaded me with "Beth" by Kiss. Jealous?

7.description: Why is this named Loncar Liquors?  Yes it does have a small package store at the front, but otherwise it is a classic Chicago tavern.  Inexpensive drinks and selection of deep fried food.  The proximity to the end of a Metra line as well as being a popular spot with local residents means a diverse customer base.Anyone can walk in to Loncars sit down and blend right in.

8.description: Have been going here for about 25 years to drink and eat.  Not sure about the chicken with the feather in it claim cause they bread their chicken daily and it rocks. They also have fish, shrimp, burgers, dogs, polish, appetizers, and pork chop sandwiches too (pretty tasty!).On Mondays they have hot wings (25 ct. each eat in, 35 ct. each take out).  And on Wed. they make crispy tacos for $1.50 ea. which are not as good as mommas but worth a try.I usually come in 2 - 4 times a month for some beers and food.

9.description: good place sad to say there was a fire there last night

0.description: The service is great they have a really nice lady I think her name was Chris super nice and made the dive bar seem a little better! The food is decent Location is good right off the train It's definitely a whole in the wall though a little scary but worth it

4.description: Been wanting to be in the area again to have the biggest and tastiest basket of large shrimp....Loncar Liquors has been in the neighborhood for many years now.....they are known for their fried chicken but yours truly loves the shrimp here !!!! Chon the bartender hooked it up...I felt as if I was dining in a five star restaurant with his attention to detail...Butch and Teresa the owner's should be proud that his people are doing a great job when they are not there.....soooo remember when your  in the neighborhood stop by and enjoy one of Chicago's best  !!!

1.description: Marzee.  Absolutely delicious.  Sean is an artist with a cupcake.  With all of the gourmet cupcakes out there, I would rate these with the best

0.description: Myself and strawberry cheesecake have a very weird addiction to each other. Needless to say of all he deserts and goodies that I have had in my life somehow the decadence of the cheesecake is alluring and in my opinion if done right can easily argue to be in the top 5 deserts of all time. I have tried cheesecakes from top 5 star fine dining all the way down to your mom and pops so its easy to say I have a very trained pallet for cheesecake. Sweetthangs Bakery by far EXCEEDED my expectations in a cheesecake. Lets be honest you don't get cheesecake because its healthy for you. This is the criteria in which I judge my cheesecake: decadence, richness, creaminess,sweetness and most of all important the crust. They hit the nail on the head satisfying all of my tastebuds and sending them into a frenzy at the same dam time. and I loved it!!!! The ordering was easy I placed my order the turnaround time was a day, I paid and had my cheesecake. Simple. The have exceptionally stellar customer service. Its a in house bakery and all the orders are custom.  The minute these guys get into a retail facility they will be a extreme force to be reckoned with within the baking community. If I could I would give these guys 20 stars. The holidays are around the corner. I urge you guys to check them out for all of your baking needs.

My daughters were looking for a couch and a loveseat.  They wanted something affordable, but also something that would last a long time.  They found huge selection here at the right price.  Sales people were very accommodating and they are thrilled with their purchase!!

3.description: Let me begin with a positive. The food is absolutely phenomenal. I honestly don't have any complaints regarding the quality of food. The only complaint I have is the service. The waitress (which works the bar) is EXTREMELY slow. It literally took us 40 mins to get some fried chicken and a couple of sides. The chicken is fried to order which is a good think because it's fresh but Good Lord, they are slow. We were never checked on again, asked if we needed a refill, napkins, anything. I asked for my check once our meal came because we had been sitting so long. I had to ask for my check 3 times during the course of our dining. Eventually once we were done, I walked to the register to pay because our check was never brought to our table. Go for the food and not the service but be prepared to wait a while so take a good back and a semi full belly

1.description: So when I came here the atmosphere is homely like visiting a relative kind of. The waitress came to my table not long after I had been there. She was nice nothing special. The food took very long to come though. Once it did it was pretty good. Not amazing but good. It looked okay tasted better. I love that it's a black owned business but I can't say it would ever be a "go to" for me.

2.description: I really enjoy being a patron of Black owned businesses, but I am sad to say the food here was not appetizing. The waitress took forever to get to my sister and I; when she did, she brought us menus where they didn't have most of the items on there. We decided to go there because it was down the street from our church and the reviews seem to be pretty good. I guess reviews don't always matter especially in this case. I will not be returning and if I had an option, they wouldn't receive any stars. I guess the one star would be for how welcoming the people were and that's it.

5.description: The food is outstanding. Great homemade taste. Love the candied sweer potatoes and the cabbage. I'm blessed to know the cook personally and I know this food is all made from scratch. The portions are good and filling. I thought I wouldnt  finish the meatloaf bit I ate the whole piece. Very old school atmosphere. Staff is pleasant.

6.description: I've never had anything I didn't like here. The cook is focused and serious about pleasing your stomach!

7.description: OK this little place is my lil heaven on earth when it comes to soul food! One of those joints that is hidden laid back grown folk atmosphere and hell of some good cookin' The travel is worth it if your not a south siderI go here to relax and have d best soul food ive tasted in chicago hands down and when I dine in i love it they have some serious old school tunes on the jukebox!

8.description: I just love this place!!!  The food is so good!!! Try the beef short ribs...they are fall off the bone tender and seasoned to perfection!!!

9.description: Ordered the pot roast, string beans, rice, gravy and greens.  The green beans were tasty even though they were canned, the pot roast was tender but had no seasoning,  Rice is rice but the gravy was made from  a mix.  The greens and corn muffin were very good.  Be consistent, New Look.  Maybe the made to order chicken or catfish is better.

0.description: The almond battered fried chicken was finger liking good...I bought a Groupon trying this restaurant and to my surprise,  the food was great, I had collard greens and candied yams with corn bread...I need someone to carry me out of here and take me home and put me to bed. .Lololol,  I highly recommend The New Look Restaurant for soul food and good soul music...

4.description: Love this place. The fish is amazing, red beans and rice are delicious, staff makes you feel like you're at home.

29.description: Where do you go when your five-year-old must have an R2D2 or for that matter a Punky Brewster action figure? Rather than keep the WONDER-filled eighties to ourselves my husband and I can safely watch any 70s or 80s show on YouTube (Luddites we have no converter box) without fearing we will not be able to provide our children the stuffed and [sic] plastiicized versions of TV characters we enjoyed. Quake has them. All of them, every last one....even ones I had forgotten like those knockoff Care Bears whose name escapes me now. Ten bucks get you the TV tray. For three dollars you can buy an R2D2 and  quiet a begging child with - that's the best bargain I have ever found!PSOn top of everything the owner threw-in a figure said five-year-old begged for. Right off the L too!

42.description: This place , I can really sink my teeth into. I am an uber toy freak , and am a hardcore child of all toys from the 80's. They have a tre' bitchin selection of older and newer Star Wars stuff , older and newer Transformers stuff , GI Joe and He Man stuff. If I had some more discretionary income , I would probably contribute greatly to the owners kids college fund. Sadly , I can't fathom spending a ton of cash on any 1 toy. They do have some cool bargain bins where if you are not too uptight about condition or missing parts and pieces, you can find some cool stuff. If you do have a need for a rare figure , and have a little cash to spend , you have a pretty good shot here.

23.description: I don't even like action figures and I love this store!  I really don't even think YOU have to like action figures either to appreciate this place.  This store must contain every action figure ever made and then some...an action figure hoarders dream!  I may never buy anything from this store, but I just can't help going in there every once in a while...makes me smile.

47.description: I found this shop on my way to the Davis Theatre years ago.  They sell toys and collectibles, both new and used.  A lot of rare and vintage items make you feel nostalgic while you look around, a lot of items from 60's and 70's tv shows and movies can do that to you!

8.description: LOVE LOVE LOVE Quake!  Whenever I'm in Lincoln Square I always have to stop here even if I have no intention of buying anything.  My kids appreciate retro toys from my childhood and I always find cool things here that I wish or did have as a kid.  I haven't checked out their Schaumburg location yet but I'm in the West Suburbs so I will def make a trip there at some point.

31.description: The first time I went into this store I was on sensory overload. trying to take in every action figure crammed onto the shelves behind the register. A great selection of GI Joe and star wars figures. Don't be afraid to describe a toy you remember as a child to the dude there, he can usually point you in the right direction. For me it was starcom  miniature figures with magnetic feet that I was denied as a child.

34.description: Who doesn't love toys!!!  Especially if they bring back found memories before all of this pressure and responsibility of being an adult (ha!). I swear I get giddy when I walk in here and I'm like look at this and this and THIS!!! Then my friends are like shut up....and check out this and this.Quake has almost every single toy from the 80's & 90's for boys and girls. I want to by them all up but then I know that I would just be stuck with them in a box somewhere which is probably why my mean mommy threw them out to begin with. He-man, Thunder Cats, Transformers,  all of the ACTION FIGURES (not dolls) a boy or girl could want. Jem, Poppels, Rainbow Brite, all of the dolls a girl or... um boy could want. Every time I saw my Nana she always gave me a Poppel when I was little...I don't know why. But my G.I.Joe's would rip them open to get inside to keep warm like Luke Skywalker did and then they use to jump out as a surprise when Cobra was around......sorry sorry flashback. At least I didn't go into how my mother made me dress like Andy for Halloween one year from Raggedy Ann and Andy.So everything is really cheap here and owner is a very cool guy. Stop on by and have a blast from the past.

16.description: Amongst the many vices I collect, toys are pretty high on the list. I'm pretty eclectic in what I enjoy, but lately I've been having problems with a certain subsect of toy collecting - MIB/MIC - that's Mint In Box or Mint On Card.See, when I was growing up, my favorite shows were Batman The Animated Series and the original run of the Ninja Turtles. While there are tons of toys I'm more than happy to remove from their cards so that they can breath freely and move about on my shelves, action figures from those two shows tend to stay on the card if I can find them in such a condition - that is to say I have a hard time finding them in that shape at all.Enter Quake. Dave, the proprietor and sole guy on hand during shop hours goes out of his ways to accommodate requests (The Lady has a thing for mint on card figures from horror films - she requested The Somnambulist from The Cabinet of Doctor Caligari - Dave had somehow acquired it within two weeks and swiftly let us know it was in his possession and could soon be in her's). the Harley Quinn figure from B:TAS - the harder to find one - found it here. one of the Neutrinos from TMNT - here too.Dave keeps an exhaustive but well organized and well curated selection of toys and figures in his relatively small space - and he uses it well! The store is packed from literally floor to ceiling with mostly still on card or in box wares and for the more adventurous and less picky, he has large bins of used figures with scuffs and scratches for a couple bucks a piece.What I really appreciate though is Dave's particular attention to what each person who walks into his store is looking for. In my case, he knows my sweet tooth for anything from B:TAS as well as figures from the mid 80's Kenner produced DC Super Powers line (the holy grail of super hero toy lines!) and has made a point to set figures aside for me until I've been able to come in and pick them up.With service that personalized and selection that solid, how on earth can you go wrong? Besides being the only store of its kind and depth in Chicago (no other toy stores focus on vintage and out of production toy lines - just current stuff), it's just flat out a treasure to the city. Give this guy your business!

13.description: This place has everything. Action figures, games, collectible cards, all at reasonable prices (often better than eBay). The items are in great condition and new things come in all the time. It's easy to walkout of here with a toy or action figure you haven't seen since you were a child.

11.description: awesome is all I can say right now. Just go in and you'll see what I mean.  They guy who runs it even reminds me of the comic book guy in a way from the simpsons, you'll find all the old toys you remember as a kid and the owner should be the one on toy hunter,he's extremely knowledgeable

39.description: This is the greatest action figure and collectible store that i have ever encountered and i like action figures and collectibles so that is good. It is so stacked with magic that it is more or less a museum of good times and star wars figures. It also don't hurt that its in Lincoln Square and Lincoln Square kicks human butt. Take the time to dig through the loose action figure bins (4 for $10.00), for they can be a secret gold mine for overlooked toys of supreme importance to the world - i grabbed a Rocky III figure of the Fabulous Thunder Lips and an Over the Top stallone figure out of those bins and those figures are special and awesome and i like this store.

37.description: a time machine disguised as a collectibles store. every memory from your youth is stored here, ready to be reclaimed to replace what your mom sold at the garage sale or pitched to clear up space. but you're a big boy now, and if she never bought you that transformers lunchbox you wanted because brown bagging it was just as good, you can find it here and finally claim it as your own.

0.description: So many options for any budget. Huge variety. Spent well over an hour reliving my childhood and having a lot of fun picking out fun toys for my new desk. Will definitely be visiting here again and again!

38.description: I love this place. I cant go in without spending tons of money (thier prices are generallly reasonable compared to ebay and elsewhere). First time I walked in a Mazinga Shogun Warrior came home with me. I have a wall devoted to old toys at my house so this place is a haven. The guys that work there are real stand-up dudes, especially for a place where you would expect a snarky holier-than-thou comic book guy type. Just a little out of the way for me. Must plan a day to go and nerd out.

27.description: An eclectic kid-friendly toy and collectible store has something for everyone. Reasonable prices ensure that you will not only leave with something you like but something you can afford.The owner is nice to everyone who walks through the door and willing to let you touch and reminisce.Did I mention every inch of the store is covered in vintage and some modern toys? Check it out!

32.description: A lot of great stuff here. I love looking at the classic transformers. Sometimes overpriced but he gives you a good deal on a lot of things as well.

48.description: A fun stop.  As someone else mentioned, it's a little place, but it's packed to the rafters with action figures, dolls, lunch boxes, weird board games.... you name it.  Rainbow Bright, Welcome Back Kotter, Battlestar Galactica, M.U.S.C.L.E. Men.  I'm not a collector, so I don't know how it stacks up in that world, but I do know it's a fun place to duck into, have some nostalgic laughs and maybe buy something you used to have when you were a kid.

44.description: Great toy store. they have almost anything your looking for from old to new. I have known the owner of quake for years 10yrs almost and he by far has the best in toys in chicago.

24.description: What a fun shop!  I had a blast digging through the bins full of old, wonderful toys and seeing all the eclectic and silly things inside.  Definitely a wide variety of collectibles, but I was much more interested in the one-of-a-kind oddities.  The gentleman at the counter (the owner, I would imagine) was fun and polite and very cool.A lovely place - I'm glad to have stopped in on a whim. ^.^

7.description: LOVE THIS PLACE! I was working on a project which required a lot of toy guns and Dave (the owner) came through. Great guy. Great shop. A truly honest business. Lincoln Square's finest.

49.description: This store is one of a kind.  They have all kinds of stuff that most of us around 20-35 played with as kids, from GI Joes, to Star Trek to Star Wars action figures.  The store is fairly small, but it is well laid out to fit all kinds of toys and t-shirts inside.

40.description: Thanks quake for letting me buy-back the toys i blew-up all those years ago.  Jesus, I love this place.  I have to disagree with some reviews saying that the inventory never changes.  It always changes...people bring new items all the time, and take others away.  Thats why trips to this place are always different, always some old memory waiting.  I promise Quake, I will really try this time not to blow my toys up.  Too much.

30.description: went in and if I still blindly spent money on toys I would have been in heaven.  They had everything you could possibly want and not want from the 70's to today.  But it was really hard to find stuff in such a squashed location.  Cool store, but I don't if a trip out to Lincoln from Rogers Park would ever be worth it.

46.description: Quake Collectibles is the absolute embodiment of vintage. Nothing ever changes in this place from the proprietor's appearance, the selection of mostly old toys, the lunch boxes that line the highest shelves and even the one guy always sitting in the corner behind the counter surfing eBay. Always the same scene at Quake. I can't find it in myself to actually buy stuff here, I just browse and reminisce. They have all the classic GI Joe action figures as well as a surprisingly comprehensive Star Wars selection ranging from the old 80's Hasbro line all the way to the newer Power of the Force releases.   Another fun section is what I've dubbed The Island of Misfit Toys, basically a bin or two of action figures that have lost their way. Some are missing their limbs or head, others just a head without a body. If you ask nicely enough, the owner might just let you take a piece for free to complete that art school assignment of yours.

1.description: So what Matt W wrote nearly 10 years ago(wow it was that long ago), is accurate even today. Just one of those places I always forget about reviewing, but finally am now.I'm not a toy collector by any means, but it's fun to browse here just for the nostalgia factor of remembering toys from years ago. The prices seem oriented towards the toy collector's market, so I'm not sure if I'll buy a lot of things here if ever, despite that a few things tempted me if only I had more money. Owner is friendly, and they do sell random toy parts for whatever reason. I've never seen any other used/new/collector toy stores do that! Heck, I even saw vintage lunchboxes from the 70s-90s.I think Quake could use a slightly bigger storefront and maybe could expand into the storefront next door via knocking out the drywall between the neighboring storefronts, were the one next door ever becomes vacant? IMO, the aisles are a little tight to maneuver and felt a little cramped, due to the insane amount of toys I saw here. Otherwise, I enjoyed this store when I revisited, and dunno why I don't drop into here more often. That'll change, though. I'd also like to eventually visit their Evanston store(if not also Schaumburg, since that's more of a trek away for me), to see how it compares.

9.description: Don't go here when you're broke because you can get a lot of good, random stuff. The store is literally packed with old toys and collectibles. The good thing about this place was that everything was reasonably priced. Another bonus to the store is the great location. You're within walking distance of lots of cool stuff in Ravenswood.

26.description: This place is terrific..Its like being on a treasure hunt. If you take your time you'll fid something very cool at a great price. It is a little disorganized..but so much so that it adds to the charm. Go check it out!!

25.description: Where was this place when i was a kid?    It makes me angry that all the figures that i used to have are all here.  Plus, the ones that i wanted for so long were here!!!   Anyhow, I dig their selection of super-hero figures and their G.I. Joes.  The guy who was working there (is he the owner) was a very cool guy.  Tried to help me find some G.I. joes (Hahaha.. hey, there were a big part of my childhood), but his place was full of a lot of other stuff, that they were scattered around.   No matter, i had fun looking through my past figure by figure.   I am definitely coming back here again

12.description: Even if you're like me & you're not into collectible stuff, this is still a fun shop to pop into & look around. There was a case near the register that was piled with Star Wars action figures.

21.description: Amongst the many vices I collect, toys are pretty high on the list. I'm pretty eclectic in what I enjoy, but lately I've been having problems with a certain subsect of toy collecting - MIB/MIC - that's Mint In Box or Mint On Card.See, when I was growing up, my favorite shows were Batman The Animated Series and the original run of the Ninja Turtles. While there are tons of toys I'm more than happy to remove from their cards so that they can breath freely and move about on my shelves, action figures from those two shows tend to stay on the card if I can find them in such a condition - that is to say I have a hard time finding them in that shape at all.Enter Quake. Dave, the proprietor and sole guy on hand during shop hours goes out of his ways to accommodate requests (The Lady has a thing for mint on card figures from horror films - she requested The Somnambulist from The Cabinet of Doctor Caligari - Dave had somehow acquired it within two weeks and swiftly let us know it was in his possession and could soon be in her's). the Harley Quinn figure from B:TAS - the harder to find one - found it here. one of the Neutrinos from TMNT - here too.Dave keeps an exhaustive but well organized and well curated selection of toys and figures in his relatively small space - and he uses it well! The store is packed from literally floor to ceiling with mostly still on card or in box wares and for the more adventurous and less picky, he has large bins of used figures with scuffs and scratches for a couple bucks a piece.What I really appreciate though is Dave's particular attention to what each person who walks into his store is looking for. In my case, he knows my sweet tooth for anything from B:TAS as well as figures from the mid 80's Kenner produced DC Super Powers line (the holy grail of super hero toy lines!) and has made a point to set figures aside for me until I've been able to come in and pick them up.With service that personalized and selection that solid, how on earth can you go wrong? Besides being the only store of its kind and depth in Chicago (no other toy stores focus on vintage and out of production toy lines - just current stuff), it's just flat out a treasure to the city. Give this guy your business!

17.description: Probably my favorite store in the world. Dave the owner is friendly, funny, and very knowledgeable on all things from Star Wars to Strawberry Shortcake.   Quake is a store full of everything you had as a kid, and lost, sold or blew up as a teenager, with tons of vintage toys both loose and carded.

10.description: The store is packed from top to bottom with action figures.  I enjoyed looking around but I was really hoping to find more in the way of pez dispensers, lunch boxes and some stuff from 60's.

5.description: Seriously, the most awesome store ever!  I read a lot about this place and finally made the journey up there (I live in Pilsen).  My 3 1/2 year old son is starting to get into Star Wars (the original trilogy).  We picked him up a few figures before, but I wanted to find a vehicle for  the guys to go in.  I walked in the store and was blown away.  This place has everything you can imagine.  I told the owner what I was looking for and he pulled out an X wing fighter, with all of the parts, just like the one that I had when I was a kid.  He gave me a great deal, and gave me some Star Wars cards for my son.My son gets home tomorrow (he and his mother are visiting his grandparents in Portland, OR) and he is going to totally freak out!  Thanks Dave.  We will be back soon!

3.description: If you had a lot of toys in the 1980's or the 1990's then this place will be very awesome to you.  I had no idea that they still had toy stores around.  A friend told me about this place so I came in here one day to check it out.  As soon as I walked in I was amazed at how many toys they had from so many different years.  They had a vast selection from all the different toy lines.  Some of the action figures were in bins but a lot of them were hanging on the wall the way they were when they first hit the shelves.  Not only did they have a vast selection but they had some good prices.  The person behind the counter was also very helpful & knowledgeable about the poducts.  This store is also located in a convenient area.  Since I have visited this store I have also checked out a few others & none really compared to this one.  So between the good selection & the friendly service this is a great place to visit.

35.description: My Boyfriend dragged me in here. He loves this cluttered 80's toy haven.  All the toys he ever had/wanted/Mom wouldn't buy him from 20 years ago CHEAP! like 50 cents a pop cheap. I was making fun of him. Like laughing-at-you-fun-of-him, BUT THEN *lights, camera, action* I saw my childhood hero: Jem! Yes, Jem of the Holograms and 80's cartoons- Shut up- Jem largely influenced my total obsession for clothes (Preferably, new ones for each episode... I mean... day...) and cheesy "truly outrageous" storylines. I couldn't help myself. She went home with me along with some quirky Farrah Fawcett and 60's kitsch Batgirl refrigerator magnets. I outspent my boyfriend... again... and he made fun of me. Looks like Jem is gonna beatdown G.I. Joe, Mr, T and Luke Skywalker tonight! (Not He-Man though, he's going to help Jem decide what accessories to wear!) Showtime!

19.description: Propietor David Gutterman is one of the nicest people you will ever meet. He runs Quake with an obvious labor of love. He is always there. In fact, I've never seen anybody except David working in the store.And, all important: the inventory of superhero, movie, TV sitcom, comic book and action hero memorabilia, ROCKS. I am never here without finding something noteworthy, fun, and fun for big kids, too.Quake will bring your childhood back in a big memory rush.

28.description: Propietor David Gutterman is one of the nicest people you will ever meet. He runs Quake with an obvious labor of love. He is always there. In fact, I've never seen anybody except David working in the store.And, all important: the inventory of superhero, movie, TV sitcom, comic book and action hero memorabilia, ROCKS. I am never here without finding something noteworthy, fun, and fun for big kids, too.Quake will bring your childhood back in a big memory rush.

45.description: Matt W summed it up best for me. I love walking into Quake, but can't seem to find anything I must have. Everything makes me remember my younger self and GI Joe play dates at Albert Finn's house. I never liked actually playing with the GI Joe's - just setting them up in massive battle scenes and staring at the scene from different angles. But that's a different story.Quake has an immense amount, a crushing amount of toy goodness going on. It's not your standard toy store where the toy in the front of the rack is the same as all those behind it. If you're drawn to a place like Quake, then you'll have to physically peek behind each one to discover new things.

33.description: If I could marry a store, it'd be this one.

43.description: Took my boys here today after Spidey3 @ the Davis.Walked out with like 7 mostly complete transformers for them and a handful of very weird and cool patches I just had to have since they cracked me up. About 18 bucks total, SCORE!!!!!Loved seeing the stacks and stacks of craptastic pop culture.Owner is friendly.B.K. (before kids) I was too embarassed to shop here. . .not dignified enough, ya dig? Wow am I glad I got over that uptight attitude today. Thank you Quake! We'll be back for the dollar comics.

2.description: I had a great experience working with David to sell my GI Joe collection. He made it simple and fair. He definitely knows his stuff, and the store is chock full of about everything you can think of.

18.description: The owner should almost rename this place "Memory Lane". Almost every customer that came during my visit spat out every variation of "I remember that!!!" This man has toys, figures, dolls, cars, playsets, etc. from the last 40 years. Although you'd see mostly the popular lines from the 80's and 90's, there are some new toys in here too.For me, I felt like Ali Baba in the cave of treasures! The way one treasure was always right behind the next...just WOW! I had to pick up some of my childhood gems that were amazingly in mint condition.Gen X/Yers, run, don't walk to this treasure store.

41.description: Ah, my childhood. There you are! Everything in this place that isn't in its original packaging I swear I played with 20 years ago or more. A great trip down memory lane. I drop in from time to time to see if they've acquired any "new" Atari video game cartridges that aren't "E.T."

4.description: I found Quake by accident, but it was a great accident. Ive recently started collecting toys and this place is like heaven! Even toys I had forgot about I found here. Plus a certain figure I had been on a hunt for online, I found here in great condition with accessories and at a very low price (online prices were ridiculous). This place is definitely a Chicago treasure

6.description: sorry i knocked down everything in your store i was on drugs

22.description: I recommend entering Quake with an open mind and no expectations, because that's truly the best way to enjoy all the surprises it has in store. If you are looking for something specific, you might not find it, but you can still leave with an E.T. glass that was sold at Burger King or a Boba Fett statue that makes noises. Everything is well-priced, and the owner is clearly trying to showcase these forgotten treasures, rather than trying to turn a profit. Bring your childhood friends and reminisce about the toys you used to share.

15.description: Great place to go and relive your childhood and yes....get giddy from seeing all those toys you might've played and longed for and now you have money to buy them!!!! Hahaha...love it and enjoy my sons' eyes brighten with excitement over the same toys!!! Cheap prices on some toys and some are just worth the splurge!!!

20.description: The owner should almost rename this place "Memory Lane". Almost every customer that came during my visit spat out every variation of "I remember that!!!" This man has toys, figures, dolls, cars, playsets, etc. from the last 40 years. Although you'd see mostly the popular lines from the 80's and 90's, there are some new toys in here too.For me, I felt like Ali Baba in the cave of treasures! The way one treasure was always right behind the next...just WOW! I had to pick up some of my childhood gems that were amazingly in mint condition.Gen X/Yers, run, don't walk to this treasure store.

36.description: I wish I had not gotten rid of all my Star Wars, Gi Joe, He-Man and every other toys I had when I was a kid.Luckily Quake has kept them all for me to come and visit. I like to come here and reminisce. And once in a while buy something. If I had more money and space, I would just buy back all my old stuff.It's like the museum of my life, and probably for many other kids my age.

14.description: Fantastic I came form Phoenix just to see this place. GReat owner spent at least an hour just talking. GREAT PRICES I will return many many more times.
